I loved how tender my short rib was although I'm not sure about the juices the grits were sitting in...I think the cheesiness didn't mesh well with the flavor of the short rib juices and it tasted a lil weird..I was still able to enjoy everything though, I just didn't eat a ton of the grits. My hubby thought the pasta was bland, So he used salt and pepper. Pasta looked nice and fresh though! I wouldn't say it had a sauce on the pasta, because it was so thin. To him, that was kinda weird and he would have rather had more of a tossed in olive oil type pasta. Overall the salad was amazing and my dish was mostly good. They also have fresh lemonade that was super good :)

For some reason I thought this was a vegetarian place until a co worker convinced me otherwise.  I have been here twice now.  The food is so good.  I had the Half Crispy Chicken(not actually a half a chicken but so good) and the Mahi Tacos.  Both are really good. I would order them again.  The Doughnut is so good as well.  Don't miss out on that. I repeat, get the doughnut!!!!

Great food! Service is ok. We sat for 15 minutes without a server, and apparently.no one told him we were his table. It's understandable since he was working in the patio and we were in the bar area. Overall, it was pretty good. I've been here multiple times and the food never disappoints. I'll be back.

Beautiful, casual atmosphere with nice outdoor seating.  The complimentary bread and spread are different and good. My Greene House Salad was okay. I asked for the parmesan on the side and did not get the parmesan at all. My son's Fish and chips were good. Rainbow trout was prepared well and very good. The Chocolate Mocha Bars and ice cream for dessert were fantastic and I would definitely get that again. Overall, a nice place for lunch.

Have lunch here every Thursday, eat at the bar.  Great service and I think the food in great.  I think I have had most everything on the menu at sometime, with the exception of the desserts which look great.  My favorite thing is the tortilla soup, but the main courses are also great.  Jamie makes a fantastic martini.

The Greene House is a very solid restaurant.  We both thoroughly enjoyed the experience and the meal.  We both liked the decor and ambiance, and eating outside in the Winter was great, as we're from Chicago, though the heaters were a bit too intense at times (they cycled on and off fairly frequently).  The service was excellent; our server was very friendly and attentive and offered advice when I had trouble deciding between 3 entrees.  The food was very good, overall.  The spinach artichoke dip appetizer was very tasty, though nothing truly unique.  My scallops were good, though I felt like the bacon strips were gratuitous and made the dish feel cheaper than it actually was.  Her turkey sandwich with pesto on their grilled pita bread was the real standout: interesting and flavorful, with just the right amount of kick.  I'm rarely jealous of what others order at restaurants, but in this case I certainly was.  If and when I ever return to the Phoenix/Scottsdale area, I certainly wouldn't mind returning to the Greene House.
Horrible hosts! Gave a 40 minute wait and were rude about it .. on a Wednesday night. This isn't miami or La.. give me a break. Especially when I saw open tables.

We decided to sit at the bar tonight! Service was prompt and drinks arrived fast. I had a classy old fashioned which I was very happy with! My girlfriend had a fancy mule. The calamari is unreal, some veges mixed in between gave it extra flavor. I wasn't over impressed however with my skirt steak, a small piece with a bit of mixed salad to accompany. My photo is after two bites. I was hoping for a better size serving. All in all it's a cool spot and very busy!

Disappointing lunch. Ordered the chicken club sandwich.  Not your normal club. The grilled chicken breast was dry. Worst part was finding a strand of hair in the sandwich halfway through. The rest of the family thought the food was ok. Not the best experience.

I would have more inclined to give Green House a 5 star rating had a couple of poor Customer Service issues not occurred, because the food was excellent:  First we ordered drinks, there were 4 of us but only 3 drinks were ordered.  No kidding, it took a solid 15 minutes to get them and I saw them sitting on the bar waiting to be picked up.  (it was Sunday and NOT busy)  We also ordered a bottle of wine  and the wine was served 1 minute after the drinks were served.    Also, I think there is a bit of an art to how many times a server should come over to the table and ask, "How are things"?.  0 is too little and 5 times is too much.  Any disagreements?  These 2 CS issues made me not want to go back.  I think its a shame, as I said, the food was excellent and hope that the owner or manager reads this.

Had a great lunch there today! Good ambience! Great service!  Tasted the chicken tortilla soup (just awesome), bacon wrapped pork tenderloin (made a bit more spicy for my Father in law) and fresh pasta with chicken (yumm)! Ended the meal with their panna cotta which was just heavenly!  Definitely coming back to try out more options in this place!!

We have been going to FoxRC's for over a decade.  What a metamorphosis of a brand! Many of our Yelps have been about their various restaurants and our experiences as diners with special requests. This includes their SoCal concepts as well.  Saturday late afternoon we called ahead and spoke with Tony and told him about our special/healthy requests. No question their Chefs would have to do something out of their box, yet simple. Tony was over the top accommodating and we came in.   Danielle was our waitperson and she was a Pro through and through and one who has been with the company for the better part of 12 years. That and full of good energy knowing she is plotting her runway towards a career in medicine..  My greatest joy was that they could accommodate my wife's healthy request and that she was major league happy with what was served.  What a win!  Tony was all over the place including cleaning the windows.  Seriously!  Fox has a way to empower their people to excel and one never gets the feeling that these people are only present as "quit and stay" staffers.  Amazing culture without any doubt!!!
I went here for a business dinner, and fell in love with this place!  The salmon entree was perfection, wide wine selection and terrific service.  Well worth it and I'll be back!!  Thanks!!

Mussel appetizer:  It was good but a little bit salty. It could've been better if it was warmer. The giant size garlic bread that served together was also very good.   Sea Bass:  It was not Chilean Sea Bass but The fish was soft and tasty. Especially the crust outside and juicy inside was extraordinarily good. And the spinach and mashed potato was cooked perfect also.   Shrimp Pasta:  We ordered with spaghetti noodle and it was little too thick but it was cooked perfect as we want.   Special:  The server (I didn't get his name) was very very kind and knowledgeable to answer our questions.

Outdoor dining is very nice. The crispy chicken, meatloaf and trout are very very delicious. My friends were able to split the chicken and meatloaf dishes without an extra charge for sharing. And try the homemade donut with cinnamon dessert is light and flavorful. For those of you who are people watchers, it's a great location particularly the side closest to Papyrus.

This was the restaurant my coworker chose for her birthday lunch. A few of us have been here before but it was years ago. It was not very busy when we first arrived around 11:30ish but it definitely picked up during our time there.   To start, we shared the the Crab & Avocado dip since it was a seasonal item. It was plated nicely but we all thought it was odd to come in a jar as it was not the easiest to get to the guacamole at the bottom. Once the spoon is in the jar, stuff would fall out so it was a bit of a struggle - not that eating is really that much of a struggle but I'm being a diva right now. We enjoyed it - refreshing for the hot weather but nothing special.  We all enjoyed our dishes. I got the Scallops entree. The others got the Shrimp Pasta, Bacon-wrapped Pork Tenderloin, and a Kale Salad.  The Scallops were cooked well with charred cauliflower, snap peas and chunks of bacon bits. Maybe it's just me but I think they were a little heavy handed with the bacon bits. I would order this again. My coworkers enjoyed their meals as well with the Kale Salad with the least loved. Who loves Kale Salads anyway?  Finished our meal with the Chocolate Mocha Bars and the Cinnamon Sugar Donut. The vanilla custard & berries that came with the donut was the perfect pairing. Think of it as a deconstructed filled donut. I didn't get the mocha taste for the Chocolate Mocha Bars - more hazelnut than mocha. It was a very rich dessert so I would share.

This is a generous slant on 3.5 stars as this is probably the best experience food wise that I've had at a Fox restaurant. I really, really do want to like them as the atmosphere and service are always second to none but the food usually falls short especially for the prices. The restaurant was quite full, as was Keirland-anybody hear about the recession? No? Good, keep spending and eating at restaurants!!  Greene House gets major props for the Mission/Arts & Crafts decor (my favorite as it embodies timeless warmth) and a very friendly server!! I ordered the pork tenderloin with penne (mac-n-cheese) and broccoli. The pork was masterfully cooked, the mac-n-cheese was okay and the broccoli was straight out of the bag I don't think it was cooked at all. The house BBQ sauce struck me as almost bitter and not very good, but my buddy just loved it. You know what they say about opinions..........  Kobe sliders were okay I thought, good fries, and my other two friends had the sweet potato cannelloni and veggie panini which I did not taste but they seemed to enjoy.  I'd probably go back to Greene House, patrons should check out the $100 gift card pack for Fox Restaurants at Costco for $80 to maximize your value.

This is my second favorite Fox Concept restaurant so far.... (Ive tried most).  I went on a Tuesday night so it wasn't too packed- no waiting.  Server was very attentive, however may have been new because he was not very knowledgable when I asked about menu specifics.  Nearly everything we had was great!  Spinach and artichoke fondue was a yummier, classier version of the (usually) boring appetizer.  I love when places serve it with grilled flatbread rather than chips!  I ordered the chicken and pruiscuitto ravoli and it was very good!  I was very skeptical of the donut dessert before trying because I did not a want something greasy like a churro or funnel cake.  Fortunetly my assumptions were wrong!  It is truly amazing and unique!  The only disapointment was the side of Mac n' Cheese.  I love trying different macs at restaurants so I made my boyfriend order it for his side.  It was one of the most disapointing Macs I've ever had.  It tasted just like velvetta shells n' cheese.  Not what I expected at a Fox restaurant.  If it wasn't for the Mac I'd give this place 5 stars!  I will definetly be returning to The Greene House in the future

Jess Rocks!!!! My husband and I dine at the Greene House an average of 3x per week.  Why?? Is it the food? Well, the food is great for sure. Every item we order is a fantastic combination of ingredients. Is it the location? The location is certainly convenient for us. But it is none of these.  It is 100% the bartender team. We exclusively sit at the bar and ALWAYS receive 5 star service and made to feel completely welcome. Jess and Jaime are simply the best in town!!!!

The green house restaurant in Scottsdale has greaattt food.  We visited Scottsdale for New Year's Eve and during the day we were shopping at the keirland commons, we had put down our name at another restaurant which had over one hour wait, as we were walking we walked by The green house, we walked in and luck it didn't have any wait, I was hesitant that it might not be as good cause there isn't any wait but, my husband said let's try it and aren't we glad we tried it.  Food is phenomenal backed by excellent service.  We are sooooo glad we walked into this.  Their Smoked salmon, tortilla soup, pot pie and roasted chicken is just amazing.

Dinner for two on a weekend came to $110 with 1 drink and no dessert. The meal just wasn't quite right. The bacon scallops had a single slice of bacon across the top. Weren't they supposed to wrap the scallops in bacon? Strange. The scallops themselves were tender and fresh. The fillet medallions which I asked for medium was more like a medium rare and the sauce that went with it didn't have enough flavor. The steak was pretty good but nothing amazing. It was the only place in the Commons that night that didn't have a long wait which is telling. Wait service was friendly.
Great salmon dinner and wedge salad  Good coffee  Good service and hospitality Did not appreciate server telling us the 20% tip amount and that we could take it off our gift card too Very pushy

I enjoyed a late lunch at the The Greene House last week.  The waitress suggested a salmon kale salad and it did not disappoint.  This is not just your regular old salad spot.  It's super fresh and delicious.  I can not say enough about the service!  It deserves 5 stars!

When we went before, we must have been there and it was a bad restaurant day!  We have been back many times since and love going there, especially for lunch, eating outside and do lots of people watching.  Food definitely has improved!  We have had so many things on the menu, salmon, salads, burgers, scallops.  All excellent.  We are definitely fans!  On Sundays, if you go, they have a bottle of wine, I believe is half off. We go and we feel like we, too, are tourists!
Food was just ok.  Nothing special - shrimp pasta, Asian chopped salad and gratin potatoes.  Service was good.  This was our second try so will cross it off the list for next time.

We came for our anniversary and couldn't have been happier with the food, service, or ambiance! The grilled filet medallions over fried rice is quite possibly the best dish we've ever experienced in the valley. Weeks later we're still raving about it! Besides the filet, we ordered the scallops that come with carmelized cauliflower and snap peas with bacon which was no disappointment either. Very rarely do we buy dessert at the restaurant since we have our favorite stand alone dessert spots, but after seeing "Spike's Chocolate Bars of Sin" on the menu, we had to check it out. Holy Moley! It was so rich, so perfectly chocolate-y, with hazelnut wafers topped with chocolate mouse and dipped in a chocolate shell, vanilla bean gelato and fresh raspberries, all lightly drizzled with chocolate sauce. Amazing! I can't wait to go back!   *** The only downside to this place is that patio dining seems to be really noisy. We ate inside but it's an open air concept so we could hear all the racket outside. Sure, it's a busy area but it's the birds that make the tree outside their home that are loudest. Weird, I know, but they were so loud, I remember thinking how glad I was that we ate inside.

Great good with a cozy atmosphere.  I work at Scottsdale Quarter so I have a plethora of restaurants to visit at lunch. This is by far my favorite. It is a bit pricey (it IS in Scottsdale after all) but this is quality eats with good service.

This was my first visit to The Greene House, and I was really impressed.  The service was outstanding!  The bartender went so far as to offer to make me a Dirty Martini with basil (if you haven't tried this yet, you should...my boyfriend and I make them at home and...YUM!) when I asked about the vodka Gimlet with basil.  In addition, when I stuck up my nose at the caramel topping for the chocolate dessert, he quickly said that he could make a substitution.  And he said I was beautiful, which, of course, always catches my attention!  The salmon creme fraiche bruschetta was OUTSTANDING and actually portioned larger than I expected!  And my main meal (scallops) was outstanding as well!  My only complaint is that I only received two (2) scallops.  Really?  I paid $19.00 for two scallops!?  Lastly, the bar is beautiful...love the FLW influence...and the place was hopping on a Saturday night, which is a very good sign!

Some of the best scallops I have had. Who would have thought in AZ of all places. I love the concentration on  use of local veggies, and attention to adding so many colors to incorporating dishes with quality ingredients. The scallops I had here were Devine and creamy on a bed of roasted cauliflower and an array of green veggies.  The green started salad was large and hearty. The dressing was the best part.

Had the tortilla soup for a starter- awesome! Wife had an Asian Salad and enjoyed it. I had the skirt steak on top of some veggies. Would def get it again.  For dessert had the rum cake, it was good but not warm all the way through. They needed to heat it longer. Overall a nice restaurant and we enjoyed it. We like the Kierland area and walking around before or after dinner.
Love the atmosphere, makes me feel like I'm in California but the food was just okay. Good but not amazing. The only thing I recommend is the Tuna Tartare Tacos. I could just order that!

Food was excellent. Servings little smaller than what I am used to but definitely enough for most people. The Kobe burger, pot stickers, and ahi tacos were excellent. Waitress was very friendly  Less a fan of the scottsdale location and crowd. Reservations are a good idea because it is busy on a Saturday. For happy hour, probably good deal with 1/2 price bottles of wine

I've visited this location three times -- once for lunch, another for Happy Hour, and then for dinner. All three experiences were wonderful.  For lunch, the ambiance is bright and cheery, the perfect midday stop to enjoy watching others shop and appreciate the company you're surrounded by. I had the mixed green salad with salmon, my friend had the same. We each had a glass of wine. The service was great, the salads were fresh, and the salmon was prepared medium to perfection.  Its easy to be lazy with a salad and salmon. But Greene house fresh flavors kept me full and happy for hours.  Happy Hour we split the tuna tacos, the potstickers and yes of course the warm brie. There was plenty of food for the three of us and the cost was very reasonable. I wish I could come back for Happy hour more often!  As expected, the warm brie was absolutely to die for !   I don't recall what I ordered for dinner. I only remember we dined outside and it was just a lovely romantic setting.  I wish I had liked the guy, I would have swooned a bit more.   I can't wait to go back. Fox Restaurants has yet to fail in my opinion. The hassle of Kierland parking is actually worth it for this one!

I have to say, the food wasn't as impressive as I had hoped.  I had the Lobster Risotto and it was decent, but nothing really special I felt.  The flavors were a bit off and I didn't want to ask my dining companion about her meal fearing she was having a similar experience (and since I had chosen the place).  For the food, I'd say three stars.  Service was good though, and the dessert I had was great (Scharfenberger mousse).    Ambience was a bit loud, and not super cozy, but I may be a bit of a food snob since I'm so spoiled by some amazing food in the Bay Area so I just can't give this more than four stars.

My wife, myself, and some friends all decided to go here. My wifes friends were treating due to all the help we did with their wedding. Its a very nice place, in a very nice area. Everyone was friendly and the service was good up to a point...  I seemed to get the short end of the stick at dinner. I had the scallops and greanbean thing. My scallops where all burnt on one side, and even the greenbeans were burnt. I joked about it with the waitress, who did apologize, and wanted to replace it but after waiting so long I was pretty hungry from waiting so long.... Wheres Gordon Ramsey when you need him checking the food? Everyone elses dinner in our party appeared to be good from what they said.  There was some shadiness when we went to pay the bill. Our friends had a gift card, and added a 100$ cash on top. She got the gift card back, with change on the gift card. To me, this is a big no-no. Gift card gets used first, and then give us cash back please! Now because of the money being put on the card, she didnt have enough for a proper tip. After she dropped the card off, she pretty much disappeared so we didnt have a chance to ask about it. Oh well, she got a less of a tip because of it.  Afterwards it was nice to walk around the shops and window browse.

All I can say is that The Greene House served it's purpose, but it's nothing to write home about.   It's not very distinguishable from Zinc Bistro since its in the same area.    We started off the meal with their soggy fried calamari and artisan cheeses that were just average.  My boyfriend enjoyed his trout and I liked my pork tenderloin and sauces, but the creamy cornbread (polenta) that accompanied the entree had a weird texture.   Good thing we ordered fingerlings! My friends had the Mahi tacos, but the limes were dry and another had the Kobe burgers with Mac and Cheese.    The service was good, always refilling the drinks and available.   As a whole the food and restaurant were not memorable and I probably would not ever go there again.

My hubby and I met some good friends at The Greene House last night for dinner at 6:30 p.m.  After reading the recent reviews on Yelp, I was a bit skeptical to try this place to try this place.  So glad we did!   I could not have been more pleased!     We were seated very quickly inside at a table for four at the window.  This was perfect as we love to people watch.  Kierland Commons is a great place to do just that!  Our table started with the hummus app. which was great!  Everyone had something different for their entree.  Our table had the tuna tacos, the fillet, the shrimp pasta as well as the bacon wrapped tenderloin.  We also shared a Mac & Cheese for the table. Not one complaint!  Everyone was very happy.  The stir fry veggies with my fillet were delish!  We wrapped up our dinner with the donut dessert (easy to share for four after a big meal).    The service was also wonderful and attentive.  Our server, Renee, never let our wine glasses get empty and we never wanted for anything.   She was fantastic and very nice!    Bottom line is you have to judge places for yourself.  Last night was good company, good atmosphere, good food and good service.  We could not have been happier!  After dinner went next door to North to have a night cap and watch the end of the basketball game.  Alex, the bartender at North, was terrific fun and made a wonderful martini for me based on my preferences!  He seemed to enjoy whipping it up as much as I enjoyed drinking it!    Thumbs up to Fox Restaurant Concepts!  We will be back!

Loved the food and service at this restaurant!  I had the trout and it was excellent.  My husband had the crispy chicken.  He typically never orders chicken out but said it was the best chicken he has ever had.  We started with the Greene House salad and it was great.  The vegetables were crispy and fresh.  The way they should always be but rarely are!  We split the brussel sprouts and they were perfectly done.  Jude was our server and he was extremely attentive.  He offered to bring me a sample of a wine before I ordered it to try it.  They are lucky to have him!  We look forward to coming back again.
Delicious food. Great vibe. I always enjoy this place. Love the Kierland location.

We were lucky enough to try this place on a beautiful spring evening when the walls were open tom the outside. Beautiful ambience. The fish taco plate was perfectly sized, satisfying without being overwhelming.  We also very much enjoyed the fondue appetizer.  Would definitely return!  One suggestion, some Arizona wines on the menu would be nice. given the proximity to the Westin, it would be a great opportunity to showcase some fellow local businesses.

We have been customers of The Greenhouse for years. It was our favorite restaurant but sadly I can't say anything positive about it. We have noticed that the prices continue to rise and the quality is going down. On Friday I had the fish and chips there was so much grease the fish was not crispy and the fries were soaked with grease. I mentioned it to the waitress but she didn't even respond. My wife had the salmon salad and the greens were not fresh and wet wilted. We also noticed a lot of new people. A real shame as it used to be great. I am basing this on our last 3 visits. It has not lived up to expectations.   I have spoken with them I have returned and the problem has been taken care of. This is a great Reasturant

I think I am coming to realize as I write my reviews that aren't impressive have something in common: Fox Restaurants.   I must not be a fan of their taste but again, I like the style. I love this patio, too. I came here with my mom for wine and salad. I don't remember what salad I had but it was leafy greens with a vinegarette of some sort. I will probably come back just because I enjoy the patio so much....but probably only if theres a super long wait for Zinc. I would have Zinc over this any day

I have to say this is a very inconsistent place. I have been here and it was really good and the time time not good at all.  The brick ckicken is flavorless and tastes very chickeny. It is moist though.  The steak is the only time I have ever like steak at a restaurant, But it has been bad too.  The short ribs are good but not amazing   the best thing I ever had there was a seasonal walnut ice cream it doesnt sound that great but it is truley amazing  I do like this place but for the price and inconsistensy not so good.   Its a gamble

Well Zin is too crowded, so why not another FoxRC restaurant and it was a nice surprise; good going Trish!  Spinach Artichoke Dip, Chicken Club Kobe Burgers make comfort food a necessity for flu victims like us ;). Great service, location and funkadelic music...unique all the way, even with the double clear coffee cups.  Hint:  ask for extra bacon strips so you will be happily greeted by big nosed doggies :)

The Greene House never fails to exceed my standards of excellent food and service -- (and trust me, my food standards are quite high) and this dining experience was absolutely enjoyable and without exception a wonderful dining experience. Kim, our waitress, was exceptional on service, knowledgeable, and extremely attentive - not only to our table/needs - but also to the other tables she was serving around us (oh yes, I was definitely watching and observing her flawless service to each and every customer she spoke with). She made us feel like we were part of the Greene House family (and if management is reading this, Kim deserves a raise, bonus, pat on the back, free movie tickets, etc). And I'm not sure what it is about the Greene House, but everyone -- and I mean everyone that works here has a smile on their faces! :) Now THAT'S what I like to see -- happy smiling people. So whatever you're doing (management), whether you're spiking their drinks with happy juice or just being plain awesome, it's working! Happy, smiling employees make for happy smiling customers that will be coming back for another wonderful dining experience... Yes, that's me saying "I'll be back" (like in the movie Terminator, lol). So, in short -- Thank You!!! :)
Other than the noise  we really like coming back here.  Food is always consistently good.  Only one so so meal, that was the flank steak.  Great mall to walk around after dinner.

I really didn't really look forward to this restaurant because I was skeptical but I really enjoyed my chicken pot pie. The servings were perfect and all of my friends enjoyed their food.   I'm really happy with their work toward creating a greener environment. The price was fair and I really can't explain how good my chicken pot pie was.

Browsing at Kierland Commons and wanting a wine break, we walked into The Green House.  The walls are open for the cool desert night time air and the decor is a subdued modern with candle lights.  Our bartender swiftly greeted us and served cool drinks. My daughter had the fig mule which is a cool twist.  I will be back.

Reliably good food at reasonable prices - for the Scottsdale area.  In other towns it would be the five-star out-standing restaurant.  The food is California-American. My salmon dinner was nicely prepared and presented; service was excellent for a busy Saturday evening.

We made a reservation.  I was in town for business.  The brie appetizer was delicious with nuts, dried fruit and fresh bread.  The potstickers, since I'm Chinese, were not as I expected. They were tiny and a bit wet,salty and brothy for my taste. I'm accustomed to a larger dumpling that is crispy on the exterior and more crunch in texture.   I ordered the halibut and it was perfection. Perfectly moist, and fresh. Portions are a proper sizing for the health conscious.  And last but definitely not least is the chocolate candy bars for dessert. A crunchy hazelnut base, and crisp delicate crackly chocolate exterior enveloped a cookie/cake center that was light and rich at the same time. The ice cream (vanilla bean) was the perfect pairing.  I think the dessert was my favorite item this evening.  The staff, as some have mentioned, are learning.  Give positive feedback to your servers so they can learn.  They communicated well, but perhaps some need to listen to the needs of customers a bit more and smile??? Hopefully they are receptive and apologetic.   I recommend The Greene House.    When I'm in Phoenix I'll return.

This is hands down my favorite restaurant. The crispy half chicken delicious, and their kale salad is my personal staple... and I always try to find an excuse to order the chocolate bars for dessert. We always choose the Greene House when we are celebrating a birthday or when people are visiting from out of town. The prices aren't unreasonable for what is offered, and it is supper clean. The service is always great. I highly recommend it!

I have to say what an awesome service at green house. food was exquisite , drink was amazing and our waitress Alexandra was just the best like great great personality. we ordered the braised short rib and the beef tenderloin so gooddddddd!!! Definitely coming back here and if alexandra is working i will be here asap for that great service

The service was disagreeable... and it was a big bummer.  Mainly because all of there restaurants over the years have never let me down... Not only was he elusive and difficult to get any time with to ask questions or order... But when we asked about something his response was," They have improved the taste" in a tone that made it sound undesirable  or   When we asked about Ginger Stout Cake "it is just like this other dish Hot Chocolate "Boca Negra" Cake " ...  The items sound very different on the menu but the waiter felt they were the same.  The Ahi tar tar tacos... the shell was too think and was not enjoyable... that really took away from the delicate ruby red tuna...  The Blueberry Crostata was good, but nothing set it apart from a diner's baked goods.   The menu seemed boring to me, and there was not much that popped out to me.  I did not feel like I was in California, it did not give me a fresh farmers market feel I get when dining in restaurants with a "California" feel... it seemed like an up graded chain restaurant.  I like the building and interior... that was my favorite part. I would go to North next store... same owner, but better management.

Our first Fox restaurant was Sauce, which we like very much and continue to go back for both lunch and dinner.  Since then, it's been mostly down hill. We have been to Blanco twice, North once and now The Greene House.  My feeling with each of these places is that they're one or maybe two food items good.  The rest is just m'eh!    Clearly the Fox group knows how to make a very good, flavorful taco. Four Stars good, both here and at Blanco. As for the rest of the story, to paraphrase Paul Harvey....    We came here yesterday for a light lunch. I spotted the Tuna Tartar tacos on the menu and knew I had to try them.  At the time, I hadn't seen any of the posted pictures on Yelp. Too bad .  The tacos were three tiny, minuscule things about three inches wide.  Our server did try to warn us they were small and asked if I wanted a fourth?  Sure, I said. So three tiny tacos for $13.00 and the fourth for $4.50. Were they good?  Yes. Were they better than the ones down the street at Tommy Bahamas? Sadly no.   My lunch partner had their Fish and Chips for $15.00 and was very unimpressed.  "Bland and nothing special, mushy and greasy" were his exact words.  The lunch bill for two came to $38.75, along with one Iced Tea.  A little pricey for a Two and Half Star experience..   Sorry!

Great place to sit out on the patio and enjoy a great, flavorful lunch.  I enjoyed the chicken club for lunch yesterday and wasn't disappointed...so very good and the fries were addicting as well!  Good service, great patio and great food!

Made reservations on Open table, had to change twice and cancel then reschedule reservation.  Super accommodating on phone and then in person. Food and drinks were spot on. Had calamari, tuna tacos, Brie apps and fish for main w purée cauliflower. Service and food were great. Kudos to accommodating team for flaky customer.

Another fox restaurant concept-- healthy and simple. I liked going here, the service was great but the portions were kinda small and most of the patrons were really ugly. I did have something pretty amazing there-- a marscapone creamed corn-- it was awesome!

Gotten the chicken pot pie to many times. Just as delicious each time. This pot pie is the PERFECT comfort food and has the best balance of flavors. Overall recommend for the relaxed atmosphere, bread on table, and great service.
A very cute place to have some lunch. Went here for Mother's Day and the service was great, very friendly staff and delicious food! Can't wait to go back
Was here a couple of days ago, food was fantastically fresh, I am rely not a Samon eater but I saw a couple of salmon orders going by, it was awesome over a salad!! Do it do it!!
Everything  the waiter recommended was delicious .... The food was amazing

One of my regulars for lunch.  Great salads and salmon.  Try the zucchini chips from nOrth next door; they will gladly fill the request with a separate bill.  Had a very good pasta special one evening.

This place is a gem. I stopped in on New Year's day for lunch with my daughter and it was not crowded but the service and food were on point.   Everything was incredibly fresh and well made. California inspired cooking, light, simple ingredients that don't need too much fuss.  We had the wedge salad, mussels, truffle fries and brussel sprouts.   Wedge salad - crisp and fresh, dressing has a nice garlicky kick.   Mussels - delicious broth you can sop up with 2 wedges of grilled bread. Made with chunks of chorizo sausage that add a smoky finish.   Truffle fries - fresh crisp fries covered in freshly grated cheese and tossed with truffle oil....mmmm....  Brussel sprouts - nicely roasted and flavorful but more on the soft and tender side as opposed to crispy.  Great place!

My sister and I had a really lovely lunch here the week before Christmas.  The hostess noted that I was wearing dark denim and gave me a black napkin as she seated me so I wouldn't leave with white lint on my jeans.  What service!  We had the brie appetizer, two different salads, and split the blueberry cobbler.  All were excellent.  We went back just to try the lemon meringue pie the next day as carry out and it did not disappoint!   If you're staying at the Westin across the street, this place is better in terms of service, pricing, and food quality than the couple restaurants I tried on the hotel grounds.

Popped in here on a business trip with a few coworkers and really enjoyed it.  Everything is decently priced, the menu is broad without being mediocre, and the ambiance was warm and inviting.  My group really enjoyed the fondue, fries, flatbread sandwich, and the ribs.  Watch out though - the portions are massive!
5 checkin's here - need I say more . Bar side service is quick and easy - awesome Martini's..

I'm a foodie from Chicago so I was told to check out the FRC places. I have started with Greene house. I was lucky enough to have an amazing server named Mel. He was extremely knowledgeable on basically everything. I would def suggest the Pink & Greene martini. It may have been one of the best martinis I have had in a while. I would skip the horseradish potatoes. Good but not great. Def try the fish tacos. They are tapas size and super amazing!!
A pleasant surprise.  Jaclyn was a joy. Lively atmosphere. The hummus was a unique preparation excellent.  On to the pot pie which was yummy.  Molly will be back.   Me too.

Just across from banana republic. Menu reminded me of similar items at True Food Kitchen.  This place is nice and great location in Kierland, however, I think the food is tastier at TFK.  Sorry Greene House.  I have nothing bad to say about this place.  Had turkey pita sandwich and chicken club I think?  Club was better.

The Greene House had been talked up by a few of my friends so I knew I had better check it out.  I am accustomed to the unique and delicious meals created at Tru Food and expected something better due to the higher prices, but it was not delivered. The service and atmosphere were great, but the entree I ordered was something that would come out of the Applebees kitchen.    I ordered the trout which is something normally prepared very simply and although the ingredient list in the meal's description did have quite a few ingredients it was how they were put together that ruined the meal.  When the dish was brought to the table I thought, "this isn't mine" because of how it looked.  Trout should be served very simply with no breading, gravy or anything else to cover the taste of the fish.  The people at the next table even commented on it.    I did bring this up to the server who also thought they overdo it on the trout.  My friend had another dish that was quite good.  I'll stick with Tru Food.
One of my favorite restaurants in Kierland. Nice outdoor patio and service is always great. The chicken sandwich is excellent as well as the gnocchi.
Great calimari. Ahi tuna was very yummy.  Great service too. Tuna tartare tacos were awesome, order 2! Another Sam Fox hit !

O.K.  One of our vendors took me out to dinner at 'The Greene House', and I had the Bacon Wrapped pork loin.  That, and a really good zinfandel wine, and I was in heaven.  Everyone at the table was in love with their food, the waiters were cool, and the ambiance was perfect for the night.  If you find yourself at the Westin Kierland or just at the Commons, give this place a try.  You will have a great time.

Came here with my girlfriend for a fun, casual lunch. Located in Kierland Commons Shopping District next to North & Banana Republic. Small, contemporary dining room with casual cool ambiance. Seated and greated promptly and politely.   The server addressed my food allergies with sincere concern. Ordered the hummus to start which came with thick, warm freshly cooked pita bread triangles. The hummus was delicious! A twist on the usual with lime juice, creamy feta, red onion and grape tomatoes. A must have!  We both ordered the Green Goddess Salad with Seared Salmon, cooked to order, medium. Romaine tossed in a Green Goddess dressing with thinly shaved Romano Pecorino Cheese. Tossed in were bits of crisp snap peas, broccoli and pistachios.  Another favorite!   Prices were very reasonable. I paid $36 for the hummus, salad with salmon and a 9 oz pour of Pinot Grigio, also delicious.   If you're in the Kierland area make sure to stop here for a delicious and healthy lunch or dinner. The menu was impressively stacked with one of a kind good for you eats.

I really dug this place. Really!  So, I'm trying to eat healthy (I've got some sweet ass vacations lined up in the next couple months that I'm gonna be smokin' hot for)  Anyways, this place has a lot of great healthy option.  I got the turkey flatbread, and asked for a half portion.  Done!  They were happy to oblige.  For a side, I got the roasted vegetables.  Delicious!  They were very, very well seasoned.    Add some organic green tea to drink.... perfect meal. I didn't even feel like I was dieting.    I shall return.

Love the restaurants in Kierland, they all have their own unique vibe with delectable food. The style and layout of Greenhouse is not what you would normally see in Scottsdale and reminds me of an northeast restaurant on the coast. But this is another great Fox concept!   I came here for lunch and tried the chopped kale salad (without corn) and added some protein with chicken. It was delicious and tasted so healthy. My friend had the greenhouse salad, which she gets every time and another good choice. Service is good and portions are on the smaller side compared to the price.  Would love to try this place for dinner one night after reading all the entree reviews. Maybe Sunday night with a 1/2 bottle of wine!

The Green House is a good place to stop while in Kierland Commons.  My wife and I have been here a few times. Pretty good Happy Hour food specials and the Chocolate Bars of Sin is the best dessert in the Phoenix area.

This place is amazing and has it all:  FANTASTIC food, top notch service, and great ambience.  I was in Phoenix for a work conference, and came here for lunch on a gorgeous October afternoon with two friends.  The menu looked fantastic, so we figured to get the most of our experience, we ought to share.  Here's what we ordered: Apps: 1. Roasted Beet Salad (generous with the succulent beets) 2. Fresh Pea Dumpling 3. Tuna Tartare Tacos  Main Courses: 1. Braised Short Rib (delectable - was my favorite) 2. Sweet Corn Cannelloni  3. Spicy Grilled Chicken Sandwich  Everything was well prepared and tasted amazing.  The short rib was perfectly done, so tender and well marinated.  Also, the portions were fairly generous.  There was plenty of food to go around.    The service was oustanding.  Our waitress was pleasant and had a good sense of humor.  The kitchen even split the salad three ways for us, without request.  My only complaint is that the Black and Blue Mojito was a bit difficult to drink because of the seeds, but the flavor was great.  Definitely check out this place. The wait would be worth it!

I went to Greene House with my sister for dinner on a Friday night. It was busy, but not super busy.    We waited ten minutes before a server acknowledged us. We didn't even get an eye contact and "I'll be right with you," when one of the three waiters that walked by our table.   This really put us in a funk because we had been really looking forward to eating here.   When our food came, my drink glass was empty, and our waiter set down our food and walked off. I thought he would come back, but I had to ask another waiter to get me a refill.   My sister got the turkey with hummus on pita, and felt it was way over priced for what she got. Same with my sandwich, it was decent, but I've had better. The best part of our meal was the salad dressing that came on our side salads.   I am a big fan of other Fox Concept restaurants (Blanco, North) and this just left me really disappointed.

When I'm out at a restaurant, the atmosphere must be just right. And of course the food and company! The Greene House made me feel like I was dining outdoors in California. Beautiful setting with attentive staff. On the pricey side but but the food quality is worth it. I'd definitely go again.

I've never had a bad meal here.  Great atmosphere, caring staff, and one of the best half chickens with sweet creamed corn I've ever had.  If you're on a date order a bottle of bubbly (they have one for $42 and it's excellent) have some muscles and potstickers, split a wedge salad and enjoy!  The pineapple upside down cake is a great choice for dessert.  Simple honest food, nuff said.

50% off wine on Sundays. Sold! I have been a couple of times and the service and food is ALWAYS fabulous. There hummas is some of the best that I have ever had. If you are ever in the area on a Sunday evening, run to The Greene House! The have a special on wine all day long and believe me, when you are catching up with a girlfriend, wine and appetizers go hand in hand. Plus they don't kick you out when you are the last patrons in the restaurants. Heck we were even able to order dessert as they were cleaning and they did it without batting an eye and with smile, even though they were truly ready to go :)

Love their salmon! Service is quick and friendly. It's expensive but worth it. Not necessarily great for kids since it is more upscale and pricy. Wish their bathroom wasn't outside of the restaurant though.

I ate at the Greene House on a Tuesday night around 7pm. It wasn't busy at all which was nice, actually. Since I was traveling for work, I was dining alone.  My server (I think her name was Maryann) was excellent. Personable and attentive, she helped me choose a cocktail. I ended up with the Smashed Irishman which was whiskey, lemon juice, mint, honey and a Guinness reduction. It was delicious!  Since it was just me, I chose the Smoked Salmon Bruscetta with a side of mac n' cheese (because I can't help myself). The salmon bruscetta had this amazing horseradish sauce on it and was light and fresh but really satisfying. The mac n' cheese tasted like nothing more than penne with velveeta. Not impressed with that.  Overall, SUPER pleased with the whole experience. Have been thinking about that bruscetta ever since...

Greene House is a reliably good place with a comfortable atmosphere, gracious wait staff, and tasty cuisine. Try the spinach-artichoke fondue. They also do an excellent job on their kobe beef burgers. The horseradish au gratin potatoes make for a delicious side dish. Great place to people watch, too.

The look and vibe pulled me in here for dinner. I had a couple of Kilt Lifter beers that were very good (just not quite cold enough) I ordered the Roasted Sea bass with Potato purée, Wilted spinach, Charred broccoli, Cipollini onion with Preserved lemon vinaigrette and capers. Everything was cooked to perfection. The service was very good (Natasha) and they made good recommendations. They have indoor and outdoor seating and a very nice bar. I enjoyed the ambiance and lighting. They had a nice mix on the menu which had a decent amount of choices. Bill for 2 and drinks (4) was around $100. I'd eat here again for sure.

I had a fanastic lunch today. Started with a beautifully made Rye old fashion cocktail with dark cherries. The chicken pot pie was one of the best I have had as it was loaded with chicken, sweet potatoes and herbs. The crust was so flakey and scrumptious. I recommend saving room for their homemade donut with strawberries and custard. It was  soft, light and warm. I look forward to going back.
Great food and service. The trout is amazing and pineapple rum cake...to die for. Ask for Jude. Be is great.

The Greene House is one of my favorite spots. I've been many times for lunch and have never been disappointed. My choice menu items include their Chopped Kale Salad, Yellowtail Sashimi, Fish & Chips, and the French Dip sandwich.

I've been to The Greene House quite a few times and I'm extremely torn on the review, hence the 3 star rating. I think the decor is really nice as its low key and I like the layout of the restaurant. We've never had an issue with service here which is great because that is one of my biggest pet peeves when it comes to dining out.   In my opinion the food is inconsistent from a flavor standpoint. Sometimes they hit the mark (salads, tacos, fish & chips), and others, like the last meal I ate there (Parmesan Gnocchi) just don't. It was pretty bland, sauce and all, so I had to add quite a bit of seasoning with salt and pepper to amp it up.  As my friend Eric once said, "Butter and salt are the reasons the food tastes so good at your favorite restaurant." Seasoning is key and Greene House just missed the mark for me on my last experience. However, I will be back to give GH another shot...60% isn't a failing grade and I know for a fact there are things I do really enjoy about this place.

This is my new favorite No. Scottsdale spot for dinner!  Hubby & I went for Fashion Night Out at Kierland Commons and enjoyed their price fixe menu. (It saved us about $12) Starter - Smoked Salmon Bruschetta  Very smokey and plentiful. So good I took the leftovers home for breakfast the next day! Main Course-Short Rib with creamed potatoes, carrots and pearl onions.  They couldn't have prepared this dish any better in my opinion. Short rib was flavorful, moist and plentiful.  I had to take half of this home too.  The creamed potatoes were "lick the plate clean" good! Dessert-Chocolate Cake, this was my only disappointment-kind of bland or perhaps I was just plain too full to enjoy another bite!  We received great service and loved the comfortable, yet upscale feel. You may have missed Fashion Night Out, but don't miss this gem of a restaurant!!!
Thought the food was okay, service was good and fast.
One of my favorite places! Love the kale salad. It's wonderful! And the warm Brie appetizer is fantastic! I also love the scallop entree. I've never had anything I didn't like at the Greene House.

Just ate there last night with my girlfriend, and it was AWESOME!!!  The braised short rib flakes off as you push down with your fork, the cocktails are great, and even their take on a fish taco has its own novel nuances.

I dined here for the first time yesterday while lunching with my girlfriends. When I arrived they were already seated on the patio which was a perfect place to enjoy the spring weather. Unfortunately, everyone else thought so too so we ended up sitting at a table with minimal room to move in the corner of the patio. The service was excellent (when our server was around ) but like others have said, the service is slow. I ordered a chicken salad with a curried yogurt dressing and an iced tea. Quite honestly I was more impressed with the iced tea, than the salad as it just didn't have any flavor. I will definately give this place another try so that I can absorb some of the ambiance this establishment has to offer and try something more tantilizing on the menu.

Ordered the calamari but literally got a plate of fried asparagus, onions and zucchini, Maybe two pieces of calamari.   The entrees were not great, shrimp pasta had four pieces of regular sized shrimp. The mahi tacos were less than satisfying.   Would have gotten dessert if everything else hadn't been terrible. Not worth the cost. Should have gone to Shake Shack next door instead.   Service was also very mediocre at best. However, the atmosphere was nice but didn't make up for the rest of the inadequacy. Don't be fooled by the nice looking restaurant.

This restaurant is really just medium. It has a great location but I sort of find it very over rated. Portions are tiny for their price and service could be more attentive.  It isn't a bad place but there are much better ones around

Bright, airy decor.  Our waitress, Callie, was very hospitable and attentive.  Made us feel very welcome.  We had questions about the menu and she was very helpful.  We ordered Calamari and the crab and avocado dip.  The Calamari was incredibly good.  Not a lot of calamari.  It included tempura vegetables (also outstanding) and a fantastic red chile shoyu (not too spicy, a perfect complement to the calamari).  If you like calamari, you MUST get this.    For the main course, two of us had the caramelized sea scollops.  Cooked with bacon and complemented with a citrus vinaigrette, the were outstanding.  The citrus-flavored Crossings Sauvignon Blanc complemented the dish.  At Callie's recommendation, the other diner had the braised short rib and loved it.    I succumbed to temptation and, being an incurable chocaholic,  ordered the Chocolate Mocha Bars.  They did not disappoint.  Extravagantly rich.  Really too much for one person.  Buy and share.    Summary:  Good atmosphere to converse with friends.  Great service.  Really good food.  Priced fairly for the quality of the dining experience.  If in Scottsdale again, I'll definitely visit again.

My husband and I ate here for the first time over Memorial Day Weekend and we loved it! We started with the pot stickers and they were really good. Then we had the house made pasta dish and a nice bottle of wine. It was the perfect end to our long weekend. We loved the fresh, seasonal ingredients and our waiter was very friendly and seemed to enjoy discussing food which, we LOVE!!

I was blown away at how incredible our food was. My husband had the pork tenderloin, and I had the half chicken dish. Both were impeccable. Flavors were off the charts! The cream corn and blanched green beans alone were amazing, but when you top it with a perfectly roasted (crispy on outside but perfectly tender and moist inside) chicken topped with tomato jam, it was out of this world! We finished our meal with the pineapple rum cake! It came with some amazing vanilla bean ice cream and crumble. So delicious! Our server was also very professional! Our entire experience was amazing, and we will be back!

Cute restaurant. Great outdoor patio. Really great service by Brittany. However, the food was sub par. Lettuce in the salad was already wilted when they put it on the plate. Fries were decent but nothing worth writing home for. The pot stickers were strange.. tasted fine but I believe a restaurant should always ask about sesame seeds on a dish like that prior to adding a half a bottle on to it. The broth that they're swimming in seemed useless and unnecessary. Not sure I'd go back.

Good food and nice atmosphere just next to the Westin Hotel. We got lucky and got a table at the bar - it's a pretty busy place but worth the wait if you need to. The cheese plate was so good. And the entrees are nice too. The only thing that was a disappointment is that they don't even have their own bathroom in the restaurant. They send you outside to the public restroom with all the other strip mall goers. Other than that, food is good.

I entered the Greene house for my second time in my life with great hopes for an experience like my last. My previous venture into the venue of the Greene house was phenomenal with a perfectly cooked steak and creamy mashed potatoes. This time around the menu is changed (primarily for the worse) and I had a long wait ahead of me. My friends and I had a reservation for 7:30 and were seated at about 7:32. Punctual at best, the place was packed like sardines, but with such success a fine establishment like this shouldn't be troubled by a crowded venue. We sit down and order drinks from our wonderful waitress who was very nice. Unfortunately as the wait drew on for our food after ordering we lost more and more hope of ever receiving something to eat. We were brought our potstickers that we ordered about 30 minutes after we sat down and some Parmesan bread was also brought to help tide us over. However at the moment I am writing this it has been 1 hour since we ordered our food and about 45 minutes since we even contacted our waitress. All we can do is look on in agony and envy of other tables that are receiving their food as we wait for the glorious moment. You could even equate our table to Jesus himself with what seemed like a wait of 40 days and 40 nights in the hot Arizona desert. Finally we had our food brought to our table in the shining glory that we could barely make out at 8:30 at night. I ordered the skirt steak, and man was it the saving grace of this meal. The steak was a colorful blend of flavors and had a tingling remainder in my mouth even after I had inhaled everything like a vacuum. My amigos got the Mahi tacos which were very tasty according to him and my other amigo ordered the beet salad which according to him was a major hit. Overall The Greene House serves up great food, but the challenge is waiting long enough to receive it.

I came back after being turned away the first time due to "no open seating" despite the multitude of open reservations available online.    To my surprise we were actually seated!    Even though the host was occupied, the bar tender stepped up immediately and helped us get seated.  He greeted us well.  We were seated in a nice little nook next to a window.  The room was very, very noisy.  Even our server (who was very sweet and friendly) could not hear what we were saying.  The overly loud ambiance seemed commonplace based on our server's reactions to the noise.  I ordered the "crispy chicken" which tasted like something I could have pulled out of my freezer and heated in the microwave.  It was not crispy or even very flavorful.  It came with creamed corn, which was quite dense and way too salty.  Very yellow.  The presentation was nice, however.  I also tried the fondue appetizer.  It was good, not great.    Overall it was an okay place - its best quality being the service and employees.  But I will not likely return.

Stopped here on a Sunday afternoon business lunch - stumbling into 1/2 price wine Sunday!  That's a nice way to start off the conversation!  Difficult to write a truly detailed review as we just had salads and sandwiches.  (The Asian Chicken salad was very tasty, but a little shy on chicken, and not very Asian!)  That said, we sat on the patio, enjoyed a nice Pinot Noir at a reasonable price, and soaked in the ambiance of the trendy little faux-neighborhood that IS the shopping district in this part of Scottsdale.  Looks like some great menu choices had we been looking for a more substantial meal.  So why the four stars?  Well, service was excellent, the food was tasty, and the ambiance was really quite lovely.  Would go back if in the area and had an excuse to do so!

First of all, the only reason this rating isn't one star is because our waiter was phenomenal and actually made the experience bearable. I sent back the Fresh Pasta I ordered, and got the meatloaf instead. The pasta says it's made with pamesan cheese, spinach, and melted tomatoes, but I got this weird soupy bowl of pasta with some kind of buttery, fishy tasting sauce, about six spinach leaves and two sliced tomatoes that were not melted, but rather soggy. I will say the herb hummus appetizer was served with some of the best hummus I've tasted, but the bread and butter was some sort of cheesey bread with butter that was blended with some kind of pico de gallo mixture. It seemed as though for every good thing the restaurant had to offer, there was something worse to counter it. Our table also ordered the Trout, which was very good, but Trout is also famous for not tasting fishy....it seemed the fishy taste escaped and jumped straight into the "fresh pasta". YUCK. The atmosphere was crowded, noisy, and very poorly lit. And do not get there around 8 because there are only drunk bar slobs that you get to enjoy your meal next to, since of course you can't hear the people at your table as the drunks around you are screaming about Pablo Picasso and what not. Completely unsatisfied, a waste of a prime location if you ask me.

"The Greene House - Inspired California Cuisine"  What in the hell does that mean?  Oh wait, it must be referring to the fish taco on the menu.  But where's the sushi?  We all know Arizona is severely lacking in these fine culinary experiences.  Perhaps that is why the good chefs at Fox Restaurant have brought us "inspired California cuisine," since us Arizonans could use some inspiration.  Well, hoping to be inspired, my aunt and I decided a break was in order from the Kierland experience, and Greene House it was.  We opted to sit outside and enjoy the beautiful Arizona weather.  We even got the special treat of enjoying someone's cigarette smoke wafting toward us while another prospective diner contemplated going in.  Greene House can boast quite an eclectic menu offering something for everyone without having to resort to the catalog of a Cheesecake Factory, for example.  We opted for a roast beef sandwich and grilled turkey on flatbread.  The roast beef listed the "raw or undercooked" disclaimer; but in fact, the beef was well done.  I would prefer it not have been chopped, but with the addition of pickled red onions and fontina cheese, it was a tasty sandwich.  The turkey on flatbread is billed as including baby swiss, avocado, butter leaf, and hummus spread.  The hummus spread was what sold me on the sandwich; unfortunately, I never tasted it.  Not much avocado to speak of either.  We also ordered the fries kicked up with parmesan and white truffle oil.  Certainly destination fries if you're a fan of truffle oil.  Perfectly cooked, but served with ketchup.  Seriously?  Ketchup and truffle oil?  Not too inspiring on that one.  We had pretty good service, overall.  But the California lifestyle took hold, and our server disappeared for quite a while before bringing the check.  Perhaps he ran out to work on his tan.  Although I probably wouldn't make the drive just to dine at Greene House, I wouldn't hesitate to stop in for a meal next time I'm at Kierland.  Some of their entrees looked pretty appetizing.

This place reminds me of Frank Lloyd Wright's architecture. By the restaurant's name, I expected a setting where all walls and ceiling are made of glass - just like a green house. I was wrong. It was a lot more cozy, yet still open and welcoming.   My friends and I were really impressed by the Fig and Ginger mule. It was sweet yet not too sweet and the ginger was really refreshing.  I let my girlfriends taste a small sip and they were hooked and both ordered their own.  The yellowtail sashimi with avocado and cilantro with  ponzu sauce came with 6 pieces of flavorful bites. We all wanted several servings but secretly fought over who would have the last one between the 5 of us.   I'm a huge fan of trout so it was no contest that the rainbow trout entree found its way in front of me. It was a large serving - one that could be split between a couple but not me. I was determined. I ate the whole bit. It was draped with succulent oven dried tomatoes and the tiniest conveniently bite sized fingerling potatoes, garnished with lemon and garlic.   For as busy as it was at lunchtime on a Thursday during a prime eating hour, surprisingly our service did not lag. Our waitress was patient as we made our decisions and handled separate checks seamlessly. She was kind, attentive, and made the end of our pleasant hour or so there worry-free! I can't believe that I missed this hidden gem.

The name really doesn't do this place justice. To me, a name like "Green" makes me think that this place is going to be uber healthy and while the products are fresh and delicious, it's not your overly health conscious restaurant. It's just a eatery that offers a variety of delicious freshly made products and has a nice atmosphere to go with it.  I've eaten here several times and I've had a great experience each time. When the weather behaves, the patio is a perfect option and it's in the heart of Kierland, making for some fun people watching and a nice ambiance.  During lunch, I've enjoyed the hummus and Kale Cesar salad which are both good and have fresh ingredients. During my last visit, I had the spinach and artichoke fondue and fish tacos. The fondue was to die for and I highly recommend that you order it immediately! The fish tacos came with two tacos that were hearty enough to fill me up. We ended the meal with their delectable pineapple upside down rum cake. Like I said, this restaurant doesn't exude "healthy," but instead it's the perfect happy medium. You can eat healthy if you want, or you can eat hearty and enjoy things like a Kobe burger or Chicken enchiladas!

It was just okay. The food was good and the beer was good, but it was expensive for what it was. Nothing really blew my mind. It feels like it's trying really hard to be fancy but the food isn't up to snuff. The portions for the entrees are pretty small as well.

Service was very good. The 3 stars are due to the service and my dining partner enjoyed his food. I'm Vegan and was really hoping with a name like "The Green House" I would have a few options. There are NO Vegan options on the menu. The server was kind enough to have the kitchen adjust the hummus appetizer for me to make it veg friendly. It was just ok, nothing great, and I left lunch pretty hungry. I wouldn't personally return.

My friend decided to she wanted to try this place out for one of her birthday meals. She made reservations though we didn't need them since it was pretty empty at 6 on a Wednesday. My first thought when I walked inside.."this is cute!". We wanted to sit outside so luckily they had heat lamps hanging above almost every table, it was perfect and cozy. We both ordered the grilled chicken club; our server was very attentive and we got our food pretty fast. In an attempt to be "healthy" instead of fries I ordered mixed greens with the sandwich. It looked great when it came out though I felt like the plate looked a little empty... like it was missing something. Surprisingly the sandwich was delicious! I thought it was going to be a mediocre bland chicken breast but the chicken and cheese, avocado, bacon and other ingredients worked great together. The salad was pretty good too; it was tossed with some sort of vinaigrette. My friend had a voucher for a comp birthday dessert so she ordered the cinnamon and sugar donut..it was good, but not great.  It seems like a great place for a dinner with family or a business meeting.

We went here for my sister's birthday dinner! I had the lemon drop drink (it was delicious) and the mahi tacos. I liked the tacos but what really was out of this world was my sister's side of mac and cheese! I know what I am getting next time! Quaint little restaurant and north is attached to it! I love all of Fox Concepts Restaurants.

The name implies this Fox Restaurant Concepts is big on salads, and that conclusion would not be wrong.  The menu is somewhat limited.  There are not a lot of choices if you do not want a salad.  However, the entrees my wife and I had were just outstanding!  She had the French dip and it might be the best one either of us ever tasted.  The tender beef slices had a genuine barbeque (I mean "cooking" barbeque not sauce) smoky aroma and taste to them, as if the roast had just come off the grill, with the crusty edges done just right.   Combined with the au jus and bun this item was full of flavor and seasoned to near perfection.  Be sure to try this entrée.  I had the fish and chips.  Normally I would have eaten only half the order and taken the rest in a to-go box, but it was so good I can't believe I ate the whole thing!  The coating was nice and crunchy and remained so throughout the meal.  The fish, ID'd by our server as "rock fish",  was moist, tender, and flavorful.  The fish nearly melted in my mouth.  I would come back for this again and again.  I cannot say enough about our server, Sarah.  She might be the best server we have had anywhere in sometime.  Not only was she friendly and pleasant, but she was very knowledgeable about the menu and so attentive, to the tiniest detail.  At one point I knocked my knife off the table.  No big deal, I'll just ask for another.  By the time I got that thought in my head, she was there presenting my another knife, carefully cradled in a napkin.  How she heard that knife hit the floor is beyond me because this restaurant, like other Fox RC facilitlies, lacks any acoustical dampening; it can get loud in there.  Sarah also brought my wife an extra straw and it, too, was cradled in a napkin.  Sarah filled our water and tea glasses without us ever having to ask.  She was there at the appropriate times to ask how we were doing and if we needed anything.  Her timing is impeccable as we never felt she was intruding on us at all.  Although we were both full, she recommended their Chocolate Mocha Bar desert, promising we would like it.  Sarah tells no lies.  It might be the best desert we have had in years.  Two rectangle logs of creamy ganache coated with decadently rich dark chocolate resting on dusted cocoa powder and accented with raspberries soon arrived at our table.  OMG!   Thank Gawd we only ordered one or I'd be headed to the store to buy bigger pants!  It was so good, it would be worth it to go to the Greene House just for that.  If you go, ask if Sarah is working and sit in her station.  You won't be disappointed.  Fox RC knows how to get it right and they did here.  PS:  I forgot to mention in my original review that, because it was our first visit, Sarah comped our desert!!!  How amazing is that?!?!?  You want to have repeat customers, treat them like this and offer great food at reasonable prices.

There must be a trend among Scottsdale restaurants to re-do their menus this month. It seems like every where I have been going, there are new menus which is great!  And this is a good thing for Greene House. When they first opened I really thought they were good. But then it went down hill....fast. Now with the new menu,,,they get 3 stars from me. They no longer have their 3 different menus like they once had. They now have one for the whole day which can be bad or good. There is alot more to choose from compared to before. More salads...which are monstrous! More entrees to choice from too. I had the Tomato eggplant panni which was pretty dry. It came with a "side salad" that was baby greens with sea salt dressing. Seriously the greens were too salty to eat. I had a couple bits then had to drink a gallon of water. And then of course I had to walk outside to get to the bathroom!  My friends had the Mahi Mahi Tacos and I guess they were pretty tasty, along with the navy bean corn casserole side thing! I wish I would of ordered this instead. The best part of course was the dessert! My friends had the Strawberry rhubarb cobbler, I heard it was divine. I, on the other hand, am a chocolate fanatic so I had to try the hot chocolate cake with walnuts and whip cream. De-lish!  So if you have been to Greene House before and did not like, give it another try!

Greene house has fantastic food with a comforting atmosphere. I can recommend the Kobe Burger Sliders, the Tacos, & Asian Chicken Salad. Also my Americano was double yummy.  Reservations are good for peak hours.

Treated a friend to lunch today, our first time dining here.  Food & service were outstanding.  I ordered the French dip sandwich with Brie cheese, seriously the best one I've ordered anywhere!  My side of truffle fries were crispy & perfectly seasoned.  I usually try to leave a dainty amount on my plate, but it was so good I polished it all off.  My friend got the wedge salad with grilled chicken which she loved.  Think I found my new go spot at Kierland.  'Tis noisy inside, hope to try their patio once the weather cooperates.

i came here for a work event, so keep that in mind. it was a little loud inside but what restaurants aren't these days?  we had the set menu which included:  delicious green salad with avocado (i think it was the greene house salad with avo) roasted chicken over a beautiful creamed corn and served with tomato jam  dessert was a really yummy pineapple rum cake  and the red blend chosen was also very good!  no complaints, definitely enjoyed the meal.

Was last here about 3 years ago and enjoyed the experience, tonight, not as much.  Arrived at 5pm and the place was pretty empty, about 6 tables outside and 4 inside with patrons so not busy by any means.  We were greeted by our server and our drinks arrived timely.  Order the flat bread and fondue artichoke dip and found it to be very pleasing.  Another waitress came to our table for a lemonade refill and brought back the wrong drink.   Ordered the pork tenderloin wrapped in bacon and waited...and waited...and waited almost 25 minutes for it to arrive to the table.  The male who was the food runner had zero personality and served us each the wrong plate.  Had to literally flag someone down to exchange them since they were so hot, they couldn't be touched let alone moved.  The potatoes served under the meat were a bit overcooked and burnt.  Not light nor fluffy.  The tenderloin was tasty but as we progressed with the meal, the taste was saltier and saltier.  Ordered the Mac and Cheese side and my goodness, it was made up of noodles with some butter and parmesan cheese on top truly that was it and nothing more!  This was a far cry from any restaurant style of mac and cheese we'd ever had and it was plain, dull and boring!  We could not even believe this was on the menu or served here - a TOTAL disappointment!  The waitress during dinner was no where to be seen and never came back to ask us how the dinner was.  We watched her walk by the couple next to us and shout out to them "how is it, is it good guys" as she passed right on by.  Not very service oriented.  It took about 10 minutes after we finished to have our plates cleared.    Overall the $22.00 dinner entree was in my opinion, no where near the quality of a $22.00 pork dish, more like $16.00.  We would have stayed for dessert but we were afraid it would take too long so opted to head over to Tommy Bahamas for dessert - which was amazing!!!  While the restaurant did get busier while we were there, considering we arrived with not even 25% of the place filled and the order took 25 minutes and the staff appeared to be unorganized, a bit overwhelmed and didn't seem to be too concerned that people were sitting around staring wondering where their food was...not sure I'll be back any time soon and certainly will not suggest this place in the Kierland area, too many other service oriented restaurants.  Maybe they do better at lunch with a smaller crowd?

Sitting outside in the patio is recommended for various reasons. It's quieter. There's fresh air. You can people watch: the beautiful peeps of Scottsdale. Serving is top notch. The menu is one of my favorites. Last year, they had trout; this year they had sea bass which was cooked perfectly wet. I had the roasted half chicken which rivaled Maui's HGS. The chicken came with cream corn. We split an incredible beet salad on butter lettuce. For dessert, we had panna cotta with fresh strawberries and strawberry sorbet on top. As for the wine, you can order it in various sizes which I thought makes ordering fun! Again, the service is super good from the time you call to the time you leave with a happy face.

Best meal we have had on our vacation in Arizona. We started with the Calamari. It was a good portion. Very light and crisp. Not oily or heavily battered. Served with lots of tempura veggies. We split the beet salad. Delicious! Citrus roasted beets, butter lettuce, whipped goat cheese... perfection. I had the scallops. Seared perfectly. Generous portion of 5 served with cauliflower and snow peas. My husband had the sea bass. It came out from the kitchen a bit overcooked. They immediately took it back and recooked it and the redo was flaky and everything you expect sea bass to be. The service was friendly and attentive. Best service we have had in Arizona. We had actually begun to wonder if unfriendly service was just a thing in this area and this restaurant made us reconsider that. Highly recommend this restaurant if you are in the area. Would definitely return.
Delicious fish & chips served in a cheerful cafe atmosphere by pleasant waitstaff made for a lovely lunch. Worth the wait and parking challenges.
We ate dinner there last night.everything was just ok. It's not very busy.    Hard to figure Fox keeping this place. It seems to be the weak link.

I liked everything.  I liked my wine...a Pinot Noir called Windy Bay. I liked the truffle fries. I liked potstickers. And I liked the trout after we had some extra sauce.  Oh, and I liked the bread with the bacon chive butter...yum.  I'll be back!

I really hate to give any Fox Restaurant less than 5 stars because I absolutely love this concept! I heard great things about The Greene House from my co-workers so I decided to check this place out. The inside is really nicely done and very clean. The service was just mediocre--not enough interaction with our server but he was a nice young man nonetheless.   The menu was extremely short, I felt like there wasn't enough creativity put into it. Lots of entrees and salads with fish and chicken, there's one burger (just your standard Kobe burger) and maybe 2 sandwiches on the menu. I guess I was just really expecting to have more options like other Fox Restaurant's have to offer. I order the grilled chicken sandwich (I wasn't in the mood for fish today), and I know other restaurants in this concept have a talent for turning a simple dish into something brilliant. The fries were pretty good though! Overall, I just feel like there was a lot lacking in flavor and creativity behind the menu.   Maybe I'll try it again later and order something more exciting but for now, my experience was just alright.

I love The Greene House! The first time I came here it was actually by accident that I walked into the wrong restaurant but I decided to stay. I'm so glad I did because everything I've had has been so yummy! My most recent visit I ordered the fig & ginger mule {Figenza fig vodka | Ketel One | lime | pomegranate | ginger beer} It was something out of the ordinary and it was really good. Not super figgy like how I expected but light and fresh. These days I am trying to have some self restraint when ordering so I opted for the chopped kale salad for my entrée. The salad consisted of grapefruit, pistachio, roasted corn, and an Amish cheddar vinaigrette. I added shrimp at an additional cost. Everything was perfectly balanced- the grapefruit contrasting with the sweetness of the corn and the perfect amount of dressing. Don't you hate when your salad is soaked?!   In the past I've tried the chicken tortilla soup, black mussels, warm Brie, tuna tartare tacos, scallops, and grilled mahi tacos- all of which I recommend! You just can't go wrong at The Greene House.

We had very cute outside table.  Restaurant wssnt busy but took at least 15min get a drinks. We never get bread.  Portions were pretty small.  My beets salad had no dressing and beets tasteless only shrimps was ok. Salmon was good but garnish ed with same beets. And second round of drink came after we psid bills.

Greene House has a 3.5 star average on 148 reviews and that seems, frankly, a little high. In fact, I considered giving the place a lower rating just to overly screw the the cumulative results, but I am not going to exploit Yelp's system to further push my own beliefs onto others (take note Yelp Elite committee).  After a lunch date with orders of potstickers, kobe burger + potatoes au gratin, mahi tacos, and a donut, the three most memorable items were the potatoes, drinks (berry lemonade is good), and John Mayer walking past our patio table.
