As others have mentioned, the service is good and the restaurant is as nice as any other Fox joint but, considering it is a FRC, the menu just comes off as lazy. In fact, looking back, it seems like Greene House is the result of an intern coming in and designing a restaurant after seeing what FRC has done with their other places.   Swing and a miss. When we get back to the Commons, we will likely try the other restaurants.

These guys didn't bat an eye when I asked for a table for one. (Oh, lonely business trips.)  The restaurant's supposed to be in a California style. Having lived in California for five years, I didn't think they got it exactly right, but I could see what they were going for. The decor was fresh and clean but unromantic. The clientele seemed to be either business people or families, and it was crowded but I was seated right away. They have a nice outdoor seating area.  I found the service quick and unobtrusive (they let me read my book in peace but kept my water filled), and I ordered the seared ahi tuna with a New Zealand sauvignon blanc. The entree was almost perfect. Everything was delicious, but part of the fish was overcooked. Seared should be just seared, and one of the ends had been cooked almost all the way through. Other than that, though, the flavors were fantastic, the fish was fresh, and I plan to come here again the next time I'm in Scottsdale.

Always pleased with FOX restaurant, this place is no exception. I came here for lunch this week and was happy with the food served.  I had scallops for lunch. I don't think they have special lunch menu. Perfect portion size for lunch, perhaps a bit small for dinner if you just have scallops. Price was good for dinner but was a bit pricy for lunch, (more than I normally pay but perfect for a special occasion). Scallops was cooked perfect, easy to overcook scallops but they did it right. Nice flavor, I thought it would go well with a glass of wine. Too bad I had to go back to work on that day.  Somehow I was convinced I should order a desert and so glad I did. They serve my kind of desert here. Panna Cotta. It was creamy, right amount of sweetness, blood orange was a perfect mix with creamy panna cotta, sweetness and citrusy went well, creating really refreshing light desert. This desert doesn't make you feel heavy at all.  Service was excellent. He was attentive and friendly with a nice smile. Located at the Kierland Common, because of price I can't be a regular but definitely would come back again when I want really nice lunch.

Clients of mine said they'd like to take me to lunch, saying, "Bonnie, you pick the place."  Kierland was sort of in the middle, so I said, "How about The Greene House."  Wise pick on my part.   I had the turkey on grilled flat bread.  The bread was very tasty; seemed flavored, not like the bland flat bread I've had in the past, and, yes, it is grilled.  The turkey and lettuce was delish.  I would have liked there to be more turkey than lettuce, though.  It felt a little like a salad in a sandwich.   Considering it was so tasty, I won't complain about that.  The parmesan fries on the side were hot off the fryer.  The sandwich was definitely good regardless of the amount of lettuce.   My clients had The Greene House Salad.  Well named.  Everything about it was green.  She said it was very good, and she liked the combination of flavors.   Another had the iceberg wedge salad.  I must admit, I'm not an iceberg lettuce kind of gal, but she really liked it.    Lastly, the fourth order was the Asian Chicken Salad.  He said it was quite tasty.  It looked as though it had the right amount of chicken and other ingredients.   The service was fantastic.  I think the manager even came over and asked how we liked everything.  Nice touch on a busy work day lunch.

Kierland Commons has a number of good restaurants.  On this visit, tried another Fox Restaurants Concept establishment and found you can't go wrong with this group.  The complimentary table bread was dense squares of a parmesan-herb concoction.  Delicious!  My salmon salad was a tiny disappointment in that, while the salmon was tender and moist, it could have used a bump of herbs or dressing to add more flavor.  However, combined with a bite of the vinaigrette coated salad greens, it came to life.    I couldn't pass up the excellent dessert list and settled on the warm cinnamon and sugar donut that came with a custard dip and berry sauce.  My server's detailed descripton of his fav, Spike's Chocolate Bars of Sin, was pretty appealing so I guess I'll have to visit again soon!   Liked the open, yet cozy, feel of the restaurant, and the server was attentive even though I was a party of one.  Prices ranged from $9 for an iceberg wedge salad to $26 for grilled filet medallions.  Salads were in the $8-$16 range.   A number of yummy side dishes were listed for $7 each.

I joined my Girlfriend and her Uncle for dinner on a Sunday night at Greene House. The staff that night must have been their B Squad, as the service was pretty awful for this caliber of restaurant. However the food was amazing and the wine specials on Sunday are great, half priced. I ordered the Rib-Eye and it was absolutely perfect, my girlfriend ordered the Pasta with Shrimp which was equally as good. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for excellent food and a casual dinning experience.

Unfortunately customer service by management is obsolete at this establishment. We ordered calamari, which had more tempura vegetables than calamari. Then when our orders came, my husbands was uncooked ravioli. Waitress agreed and asked him if he wanted something else. He chose ahi tuna. I was done eating and we waited an additional 15 minutes after I was done for his meal to arrive. So I ate alone and he ate alone. When we received our bill, they up charged us for the ahi, no apologies, nothing.   Will NEVER go back. Way too many other choices in Scottsdale that cater to their clientelle.

During another one of our very rare trips to this "posh" Kierland Commons area, we found ourselves hungry for something different, we walked by the Greene House, actually the baker's window at the Greene House.  Turns out it is a small station where smaller plates are arranged in the restaurant, a Garde-manger almost, where salads and breads came out, I think I even saw some desserts potentionally being cooked up there.  Nevertheless, the friendly face behind and the intriguing display window drew us in.  It was lunch time on a saturday, the place was pretty busy.  We walked in wearing clothes that didn't scream out Scottsdale, but more of the quiet, Millionaire Next Door type of look, needless to say, we didn't get seated at a very good spot.  Wearing our t-shirts and jeans got us an awkward table that felt like it was below the bar.  Half of our lunch was eaten with a waiters butt in our faces.  It's not exactly the type of warm buns I was hoping for with my butter.  The food, being avid and experienced fish and chips lovers, to try the Greene House's rendition was a must, we are no strangers to the great old fashioned greasy spoon fish and chips from accross the pond, England.  The result? Surprising, the fish was good quality white fish, if I had to guess, possibly black cod, it came with fries, not chips. "Chips" meaning big potatoe wedges that are finger length.  Nope they were just regular ole fries, a mound of it, with two small portions of the fish.  The plate was not balanced, the fries outweighed the fish (the main attraction) by a good 5 to 1.  Wow.  We asked our very waiter who kept asking us if wanted anything to drink besides our ice cold water, are the Kobe Beef Twin burgers made from grass-fed cows?  I thought, Kobe beef, it has to be, you mean to tell me a cow that gets massaged gets to eat grains?!  I thought there was no way that he would come back saying it wasn't grass-fed beef, I expected a lie, a lie that would have made me feel happier.  Nope, the Kobe beef is from grain fed bovine. That's right... the waiter got 1 point for honesty, and chef, 0.  For those who know their meats, beef that is grain fed is like.... humans who only get their vitamins sources from pills and not fruits and meat, un-natural and frankly kinda gross.  When the twin burgers arrived they were small, sliders small.  Why not call them sliders?  The "house pickles" are these strangely marinated curried cucumbers.  Who's idea was that?  It overpowered the meat, something that should stand alone really being KOBE no?  The beef could have maybe, and that's maybe passed for Angus, Kobe? Not a prayer.  On the upside, the parmasan, truffle fries were good though.  So, I guess I can't really judge this restaurant to its fullest yet, I saw potential in the menu, but also I saw a lot of pretentious combinations that should have been left off the menu, at least simplefied.    I will be back to this place one day, and that time, I will be dressed like David Beckham, wear sunglasses indoors, throw on a sportscoat and possibly designer jeans.  Maybe just maybe, then will I have a shot at sitting at one of the great seats in the house where you can see folks walk by outside, or the beautiful open kitchen they have.  Don't miss: The patio seating and atmosphere at night Skip:  the bar half of the restaurants, seats are badly placed, and save your cash with Kobe burgers that barely surpass the gut-bombs from White Castle.    For now Greene House, you get a 3 out of 5. Not good enough.

I've been here three times recently for their 1/2 wine bottle special on Sunday nights.  Every time I've had a great experience.  This last visit we started with a bottle of Angeline pinot noir.  It was refreshing and started things out on exactly the right note.  For dinner I had the braised short ribs.  These babies are tender and melted in my mouth.  Absolutely delicious!  The second bottle of wine was a gorgeous Ladera cabernet savignon.  It went perfectly with the short ribs.  For dessert the caramel gelato was just right.  The decor and service are always first class here.  I can't wait to come back soon.
My husband and I had a wonderful date night here.  Excellent food, atmosphere, and wine. The server was attentive, knowledgeable and gave excellent recommendations! We will absolutely be back

My husband and I made a reservation at The Greene House at the insistence of my foodie friend.  She claimed that I had to go for the doughnut!  So we did...  We had to wait about 5-10 minutes, even with a reservation, and the bar area was packed...we stood hovering at the door with other couples in anticipation of our feast.  We were greeted promptly and ordered wine.  As we perused the menu, it was determined that because we were definitely getting the doughnut, I would forgo an appetizer and ordered the Braised Short Rib.  My husband, however, was intrigued by the tortilla soup and fish tacos, which came highly recommended by our server.    He returned shortly after taking our order with a basket of bread and butter...my excitement peaked and then fell when I placed my hand on a cold dense roll; I was hoping it would be fresh and warm, but sadly it was the butter that was warm and melty.  The tortilla soup arrived and I quickly asked for a second spoon; I need to at least taste it!  My husband stirred the dollop of cream and tortilla strips into the brothy soup and took a taste...no response.  My spoon arrived, I took a taste, and found it to be lacking flavor depth and heartiness that tortilla soup is famous for. Even my husband suggested it needed some citrus or fresh herbs...maybe even a little more heat.  Not thrilled, and didn't even finish it.  When our entrees arrived, my foodie excitement reappeared as the Braised Short ribs were placed in front of me...glistening in a demi-glaze the short rib----though no rib to be seen- sat atop a smooth pool of potato puree and was topped with a large onion and small nubs of carrots and a piece of celery greens.  The flavor was spot on, though nothing out of the ordinary or flavor popping and the meat was literally melt-in-your mouth.  At first I thought there wasn't enough, maybe because it was so tender and yummy I didn't want it to end, but as we got closer to the end of our meal, I found that  I couldn't finish it.  Oddly, however, my usually non meat-eating husband, found it within himself to take one for the team by eating the final bites of the tender goodness; he couldn't even resist! His tacos, he said, didn't thrill him.  While the waiter bragged about the portion of fish used in their tacos; we didn't seem to think so.  As a result, I didn't even want to take a bite so as to leave more for my honey...so sadly, I can not report on the tacos...though he did let me take a bite of the white bean salad that was on the side, which was quite flavorful.  Then came dessert....we knew we wanted, as it came highly recommended, so we ordered it blindly.: the doughnut.  I was sad, however, to see that there was NO chocolate whatsoever; not dripped, none to dip, not a chip!  I was happy to see they give you the WHOLE doughtnut....hole and all, and along side the cinnamon-sugared-fried sweetness was a small ramekin of vanilla bean custard with a dollop of strawberry.  My husband enjoyed it very much, whereas I had only a few bites...it's more like a classic doughnut than the krispy kreme in that it was more dense than I would have preferred and not enough custard to compliment the dryness of the doughnut itself.  Overall, it was ok...though I don't think we would go back.

I ordered a salad and that was good. My friend had the braised rib and it was yummy. Braised rib must be a common dish in this area as they have it on a few menus at the restaurants in the area.   We ordered a couple of desserts that were good.   Service was lacking. I know we were sitting in the bar area, but waited forever to order after we said we needed one more minute.

I'd be hard-pressed to say what NOT to get here.  Roasted half chicken with creamed corn, tomato jam, and green beans - fantastic.  Braised short ribs on cheddar grits - still raving about these. Greek pitas and hummus, pineapple rum cake, yum yum yum.  The service was top notch and friendly making for a wonderful evening.  We will be back soon!
We had a party of 12 and everyone walked away very impressed with the service and the good. Our waitress did a fantastic job and didn't even blink an eye at us all needing seperate checks. Well done.

We have been going to the Greene House since it opened many years ago. Sadly, this favorite restaurant just moved to the bottom of my list. Last night's dining experience, a birthday celebration no less, was marred by a terribly over-cooked sea bass entree with tough broccolini which, when sent back, returned a while later (as my companions were completing their meals) with the same problems. I have had this dish three times previously in the past 5 months and it was excellent. The waitress demonstrated no interest in how the dish should have been prepared (it even LOOKED overcooked). The manager did stop to check on our table when the second dish was served and apologized, taking the item off of our bill. The people at the table next to us were also complaining about the quality of one of their dishes. Something is very wrong in the kitchen, and there was no chef on duty. And of course, I ended up with no dinner as I wasn't going to order a third time now that my dining mates were done. The restaurant is also looking a little shabby: seats are broken down, table was not that clean when we were seated (which we indicated to the waitress, who did nothing), and so on. Overall a very disappointing experience. We used to recommend this restaurant to our friends but for now those recommendations will stop.
Pretty good eats for lunch. Had the mahi tacos. Good portion and great flavor. Don't miss the white wine sangria. YUM!

I used to come here all the time for the half priced bottle of wine as they have some great reserve bottles.  I'm not sure why but I never noticed the guy in the back hand making the pasta.  It's fun to watch but even more fun to eat. If you aren't into fresh pasta, they have a good selection of comfort foo.  The patio is good sized and when the weather is nice the bar area is pretty open.

My first two trips to Greene House were years ago... they hadn't been open for long and both trips were for dinner and left much to be desired. I didn't return until recently when we met some friends for a late lunch on a Saturday...  Lunch is the way to go at Greene House!  It was a beautiful day and we sat on the patio... the service was friendly and attentive, and the food was fresh and filling.  It's a tad bit on the expensive side, but worth a splurge for a nice lunch every now and then...  We started with a brie appetizer and a plate of roasted veggies.  Both were delicious.  I had the Asian Grilled Chicken Salad as my entree and was totally satisfied; I'm usually picky with my chicken and this chicken passed the test... I'd order it again in a heartbeat!  Lesson learned: Greene House is perfect for a lunchtime splurge!

Omg total foodgasm. Reward for mailing my taxes this afternoon is THIS. Holy cow these chefs know their way around memorable food!  Behold braised short ribs (perfectly carmelized and tender), smoked cheddar grits, charred onion, grilled zucchini and wild mushrooms and spectaular beefy wine sauce from scratch, garnished with cilantro. Highly recommend. (Also had beet salad on goat cheese mousse with pistachios and balsamic reduction sauce, and a homemade donut with custard and fresh strawberries.).  Jeez what an afterglow!!!!!  Super service as well. I'll be back. Often.

Had a lovely experience here!  My company wanted to show me around Kierland Commons as I had never been. After parking, we walked along the beautifully lite street, enjoying the warm evening air. The Greene House stood out to us from the sidewalk. It was an open concept restaurant that had tables flowing out to a stunning, candlelit patio. As we entered the front door, the ambiance was equally as spectacular. The soft lighting was soothing, but also sexy and inviting. We saddled up at the bar.   I'm usually a wine drinker, but their signature cocktails looked enticing - a refreshing beverage sounded great. My eyes narrowed in on a  jazzed up Moscow Mule - one of my favourites! It was a Fig, Pomegrante Mule and boy was it delicious.   We wanted to check out some other spots in the area so we only had the one drink, but I will definitely be back here to try their food - it smelled exquisite!  Thank you to the bartender who was kind, prompt and made our first visit a pleasure.

We just had a fabulous meal at The Green House for Az Restaurant Week.  We started off with the warm Brie served with tart cherries, crusty bread, roasted garlic and nuts...delicious! The green house signature salad was also amazing and light with pistachios and avocado.  My main course was the pork tenderloin wrapped in bacon..OMG! Perfectly cooked, tender pork (which is impossible for me to do at home). This was served with horseradish potatoes..delish! I was stuffed but I couldn't stop eating. For dessert we had the pineapple upside cake..nice crunchy texture on the bottom...wonderful sauce that wasn't too sweet.  All and all it was a great meal. I would recommend making a reservation as the last time I came I saw a lot of people not being able to be seated right away without one with a lengthy wait.  Excellent service..the manager even stopped by to see how we enjoyed our meal.

One of my favorite places for brunch. Especially on Sundays - Half priced bottles of wine! HELLO! Can't beat that!   Food is amazing and I assume is fresh because it tastes fresh - not like it's been frozen.

The Greene House is one of my favorite places to eat. Located in the center of Kierland Commons, it is a great restaurant for a night out. They start every meal with a super delicious cheese topped bread. I usually like ordering a couple of appetizers as a meal here just so I can try different things. The last time I was there I got the Smoked Salmon and the Potstickers. The sauce that came with the Potstickers was so good I almost licked it off the plate. The bread that came with the oysters was so amazing and garlicky. I've had a lot of great food here over the past couple of years and can't wait for my next meal at The Greene House.

It is a pretty cool place.  All the hardwood furniture and windows looking outside.  The service is great!  Not the restaurant's fault, but the screaming kid (45 mins) made my head hurt!  SPINACH & ARTICHOKE FONDUE - Delicious...   CHICKEN TORTILLA SOUP - Perfect to warm up the soul CRISPY HALF CHICKEN - This was so good, I would just come back for this

Wandered in here after attempting to have dinner at Postino first and walking out on that awful experience; so glad we did!! Greene House was excellent.  The server was friendly and explained things perfectly. We had a turkey on flatbread, and fish tacos for our entrees, along w/a side of mac and cheese.  The restaurant was busy but not packed, and they didn't sit you on top of one another like so many places do.  The food came out quickly and was perfect; had everything we expected and the server checked on us often to see if we needed everything.  We will def. be back soon, and enjoy their beautiful patio and great ambiance.

What an excellent evening. Ryan was an amazing server. It was my friends birthday and he completed my request of having the whole staff sing happy birthday. We had amazing table-side service, graciousness, and an excellent wine suggestion. I would definitely suggest the chateau moulin de tricot. For the price range, it is an excellent alternative to the normal go-tos such as Caymus. We will be back to ask for Ryan specifically!!

Great place for lunch or dinner.  We go there quite a bit since we work up in the Quarter.  The Turkey/hummus/pita entree is very good.  Good place to try if you like other Fox Concepts spots...which I do

This is probably my favorite new restaurant that serves the best grilled chicken I have ever had! It's absolutely so tender and to make it even better, it was sitting on top of creamed corn. TO DIE FOR!! I think what really made this dish spectacular is the tomato sauce that was used to compliment the chicken. It wasn't like any other sauce, it was different to perfection. you would think it would be warm but it was cold; salsa texture & temperature. Definitely compliments your palettes in spectacular ways.   The service was average, nothing amazing. Very simple & to the point. No complaints.  Will be back for more!
Food was average, I had the Butternut Squash Pasta there was too much going on in the dish. Didn't care for pistachios, tomatoes in the dish. Location and atmosphere was great.

I had been wanting to go to this restaurant since I moved to AZ. I love the FOX restaurants so my boyfriend made reservations for valentine's day. I had my hopes up but I wasn't really impressed.  We were squeezed into a corner table, the service was decent, and it was quite noisy . I didn't feel that I was able to experience the vibe of the restaurant being in the corner. I order pasta w/breadcrumbs/mushrooms, and I ended up returning it. It just didn't taste right. Desert menu was a disappointment as well. Overall, I wouldn't recommend the restaurant.

all flash and no substance.  i had ravioli.  waitress raved about their pasta and how it was homemade.  that may be, but it was also very undercooked.  almost raw. really no getting past something like that.

Sorry, but I can't agree with the majority on this one. While the restaurant is what it is billed to be it just isn't that great.  My partner ordered cannelloni and it was the smallest dish of pasta I've ever seen. I had a bistro steak salad which despite being ordered medium was delivered rare. Lunch for $30 and I only drank water? That's way too much for appetizer size portions.   I like Kierland and most of the restaurants, but The Greene House just isn't that great. Too noisy, too Scottsdale (yes, I know it's in Phoenix) and too fake.  On to the next review.

Hot! stupid, slow.  Lame. Poor management. Hot. Hot. Hot. This is Arizona. Get a fan. The misters were turned off at sunset. The temp was 100 plus degrees. There is a happy medium., Fans!  They were invented a billion years ago.  We sweat like pigs In a slaughterhouse.  This is a typical Sam Fox restaurant. How do you miss the obvious? The extremely obvious.  The insanely in your face obvious.  Designed by idiots.  It is equivalent of no heat in Chicago. Does anyone have a brain with this dumb chain?

Why eat here when there's a Cheesecake Factory a few steps away? That's exactly why. Step out of your shell, my little Banana-Republic-Crate-and-Barrel shopper. There's a whole new world of individuality out there.  Even though this joint is part of Fox Restaurant Concepts mega-conglomerate, it is a unique place to try. I've been a few times on visits to Scottsdale and each time I leave with a smile on my face. Good "California style cuisine" according to their signage that pleases this Californian.  Mahi tacos: yum! Trout: Delish! Their servers: So this is where the male models work when they aren't in a photo shoot.

Get the potstickers for an appetizer and make sure you go for wine Wednesday when wine is half off a bottle. It's a cute restaurant and I will definitely bring my girlfriends back for Wednesday's. The service was also very good.

We had a wonderful meal. I had the short ribs, outstanding! My hubby had the pork tenderloin which was very good. I really recommend the short ribs. The humus was very good. Beautiful night, beautiful place

This place has a very nice patio seating. I had the crab & Avacado dip. It was actually really good. The Asian chicken salad was on point too. The service could have been better though. The server didn't introduce himself and forgot what we ordered as well. I'll give this a place a second visit for sure.

What a cute spot!  They accommodated our party of 7 (with reservations) and I felt like we were really well taken care of. Our waiter was great: patient, funny, insightful re: the menu. We stayed for a few hours and didn't feel any pressure to wrap it up and leave, which was nice. I thought the food was interesting, fresh, and delicious. We shared a bunch of apps (warm brie, fondue, calamari) and they were all yummy. For lunc I had the kale salad with salmon and it was really good!  We had the pineapple rum cake (with a candle in it for my friend's birthday) and we all savored a bite or two of that.  I will be back again for sure!

In general, I'm not a big fan of the Fox Restaurants but both times I have been to The Greene House, I have been happy with my meal and service.  We had the Kobe sliders, a Grilled Chicken Club with Tavern Ham and Avocado, and a salad.  All of us enjoyed our meals and the service was VERY good in the bar area.  I was very impressed by our server - she was quick and attentive.  Service really makes all the difference for me.  $75 for 4 of us for lunch - a little expensive considering we weren't drinking.

I've eaten here twice and I love the food! I recently ordered the Asian chicken salad but asked if I can substitute the chicken for another type of meat. The server recommended ahi tuna - the tuna they use on their ahi tuna tacos. I decided to order the ahi tuna and my salad was sooooooo good!!! I also ordered the parmesan truffle fries and they were freaken amazing too. Their black tea was great too. I'll be back!

Don't miss Greenhouse!  The Food and Service are Superior!  We started with the Hummus..... A must have!    Mussels and The Wedge!   Best Mussels I have ever had and the dipping sauce was irresistible !!!  Just ask for Perry....  He will take great care of you!   Bon Appetite  :)

Had a great lunch here...sat at the bar. Food came pretty quick, even though they were pretty busy. The food was VERY good, I had the pea soup which was great, and I had the fresh fish special which was Halibut. It was also very good. Portions are small but I like that, I'll have to come back and check out the wines....the wine list looked good!  It was about 80% women in here...which was also very yummy...

This place was great! Scottsdale is not my usual stomping ground so I went based on a recomendation and was not dissapointed. I had the beet salad which was delicious and a side of fingerling potatoes. I am very picky about my fingerlings and these were prepared perfectly! My girlfriend and I shared the pineapple upside down cake for dessert and all I can say is YUM! Definately worth the drive...

We stopped in tonight, family of 5 adults, plenty of tables available - however, they asked if we had reservations.  We did not.  They stated - all tables are "committed" - we asked were are those that "committed?"   Hostess did not have a response.  Unfortunately for Green House a family of 5 adults is an easy $200 dinner bill out.  Shame on mgt for not teaching hostesses the value of business and turning true "committed" diners away.

First time to visit The Greene House. Came for lunch. Did not have to wait for a table. At first service was prompt and courteous.  Then it took a long time to get our iced teas. A long wait for our server to come back to take our order. Another long wait for our salads and sandwiches. Food was brought by an expo(runner) and slammed down on our (very slanted) table. Not plated well.  Food tasted great- no doubt. Server didn't check on us. Took a long time to get our check. Runner picked up our used plates again loudly!  It can be a combination of the big and small things that can make a place and your meal memorable.  I would go back but I wouldn't keep it on my list of top 5. Scottsdale (Kierland and the Quarter) have other choices-many of them Fox concepts ... I would recommend those first. I would have to give The Greene House just an "eh".

Wonderful ambience with excellent food! Chicken pot pie was perfectly seasoned. The bacon wrapped pork loin served with a scalloped potatoe was so flavorful, I took home leftovers and couldn't wait till the next day!

Whenever we come to vacation in Scottsdale we have to eat here at least once. This trip we are already on our second time here in 3 days!  The vibe in the Kierland Commons is great. Fun to walk around and shop.   My husband's favorite is the salmon with getting the skin crisped on that fish. For me, it's the citrus beet salad with added scallops and avocado - this is The Best combination of flavors!!!  Their organic green tea is refreshing  - making this a healthy, delicious go to favorite!    The wait staff has always been very friendly and accommodating with my food allergies. We like to sit outside on the patio, but the inside has one whole wall which opens up to the outside which is nice too.
Great food, great service, great atmosphere.  The only reason it doesn't get a fifth star is how challenging it can be to find parking but everything else about it is great.

Fox Restaurant Concepts has a dozen restaurants in the valley, and it's no wonder.   They are hard at work, creating inventive ways to serve standard America and Italian fare, and the result is always a culinary adventure.  I dined alone at the bar one night, and had a chance to observe the team work and camraderie that exists between the staff here.  It was a busy time of night, the bartender was juggling the entire bar area by himself, as well as waiting on patrons seated at the cocktail tables.  I noticed the various servers in the dining area helping one another out by helping to serve meals, as well as the manager stepping in to assist the guests and servers.  I had a fantastic margarita, made with pomegranate juice and OJ, a house specialty.  After perusing the menu of classical comfort foods such as the mac and cheese appetzier with andouille sausage, I opted for the brie.  Served at just the right temperature, oozing with cheesy goodness, it came complete with a cherry compote and a heaping of roasted garlic.  Spreading the goods on buttery crostinis, I polished the sizeable appetizer off within minutes.   Although my belly was contented with its meal, I was now eager to explore one of their entrees.  Entrees that the bartender suggested, for someone who likes it all and is always indecisive:  Rainbow trout with fingerling potatoes, baby artichockes, and charred tomatoes Crispy Half Chicken with mascarpone cream corn, and natural jus Grilled ribeye with arugula, avocado, tomato, bleu cheese, and an herb vinaigrette BBQ Pork tenderloin (his personal fave) with mac and cheese and roasted broccoli  I opted for the rainbow trout, a fish that I love and miss from my days in the northwest.  The entree was delivered so quickly, within 5 minutes, that I had to wonder if it had been waiting for me all along.  The filet was so large that I never got half way through my meal.  It was perfectly seasoned, doused in a wine and garlic sauce, topped wtih spinach, artichokes, and charred tomatoes.  For those that are unfamiliar with this fish, it has softer meat and a "dirtier" taste.  If you are used to the likes of sea bass and halibut, this $19 entree would not be to your liking.  Towards the end of my meal, I spoke briefly with Danielle, the manager.  I had spotted this woman throughout the night, assisting the servers, bartender, and host - along with speaking to guests and showing them to their tables.  I was so impressed with her devoted participation in the restaurant.  And, well, I had to tell her what a great job everyone did that night, especially the kitchen in preparing my magical dishes.  She talked me into their "Boca Negra" cake, the traditional hot molten lava cake, coated in a dreamy caramel sauce and topped with vanilla bean ice cream.  A wonderful end to a delicious night

My husband and I have been fans of The Greene House since we first visited there about 5 years ago.  Every time we come to Scottsdale, we make a trip there so that we can have the fish & chips.  Without question, they are the best we've had anywhere and I am a bit of a fish & chips fanatic.  Friends of our came in from Chicago this weekend and I told them about the food there, so they just had to try it.  We ordered the fish and chips and the tuna tartare tacos.  Our friends agreed that the fish and chips were the best and the tacos were excellent as well.  They enjoyed it so much that they wanted to stop there on their way to the airport for lunch!  Their reviews say a lot because one of them is a partner in Sunda in Chicago.  Would give them 5 stars, but the service can be inconsistent.
Great food but shitty service after dinner. They close at 9pm and are extremely rude about people hanging around afterwards. How disappointing

Been here several time.  I like the wine selection it's not overdone but a nice selection.  Wednesday is 1/2 off wine by the bottle which is fun because you can try something that a little more pricey .  Always a good meal too.
We were told about the The Greene House by a friend . It more than lived up to there description. Service was great and the food excellent. We would we definitely go again.

Great place to solo dine or share a meal with your part time lover and full time friend. I wandered in here the first time, while on my way to solo dine elsewhere, and fell in love. It was the menu that got me.  I actually continued on, to my intended destination, then turned back after realizing that the Green House's menu was so much more interesting. I had to try those Tuna Tartar Tacos!  I sat at the bar and had the Tacos, a cheese plate and a bottle of wine, for half off.  The cheese selection was diverse and highlighted some cheeses from California, which I may have passed over otherwise in the market.  I am a fan of the Humboldt Fog, but who knew California could make such a great gooey Brie?! The cheese plate came with fresh dried peaches, cherries and grapes as well as blanched almonds.  Yum!  I thought I would skip right over the fruit, but ended up enjoying it.  I went back again with my boyfriend.  We shared a multitude of appetizers, and loved every one of them   as well as our sweet and cheerful server.  He liked the truffle French fries most of all.  I actually drove 4 hours just to have an excuse to eat here again!
Best Asian chicken salad in Scottsdale!!!  Super fresh, farm to table taste!!!  Will definitely come back!!  Great menu!!!
Loved the fondue appetizer. The entrees were good too. Easy to make reservations with Opentable. Will go back with out of town guests.

I met a friend for lunch here before a design show.  It was the perfect prelude!  It was a warm sunny winter day in AZ and dining alfresco was in order.  We both ordered drinks; I had the Black & Blue Mojito and she had the Fesca.  We shared the White Truffle Paremsan and Chive Fries!  Yummy!   I was warned that my drink was sweet but honestly it paired well with the Turkey on Grilled Flatbread with a side of mixed green salad.  The Turkey sandwich was made with a tasty hummus, avacado and fresh tomatoes.  I like simple, uncomplicated taste - maybe that's why I like the Fox Concept Restaurants so much.  The outdoor patio is great for people watching as well as soaking up the great AZ weather.     I hope to eat here again soon.

Did not enjoy our lunch here.    Had to wait for a hostess to even come to the hostess stand to seat us.    The waitress took even longer.   This was on a Thursday at 2:30 in the afternoon.     It's not like it was a busy time.      Ordered the brie appetizer, wedge salad, fish and chips and shortrib.     The wedge was good but  the portion on the fish and chips was way too small.   Very poor quality cod.   My husband thinks he got some type of food poisoning from the short rib.   He was sick all night.    Would definitely not go back.    Also very expensive, not worth the money.

I went there for lunch at 11:30 on a weekday, had the fish and chips. The front desk was a little chaotic, but we were seated relatively quickly and the server promptly came to the table. Service was excellent as was the speed of the kitchen.  The fish and chips were not to my liking. It seemed like the oil wasn't hot enough.. The breading was soggy and the fish was mushy. It tasted greasy.  It's a great location for a restaurant and if you find yourself in the shopping center, you  shouldn't feel bad going here. But I wouldn't make this restaurant a destination.

Good food, great service (Ryan) our waiter was super nice.  The black mussels appetizer were delicious and the house salad was excellent! My friend had the kale salad was yummy as well.  Love the Riesling, it was just perfect for my taste.  The negative part was, very noisy and I couldn't even hear when our waiter was explaining for the special menu.  Overall it was great.

One look at the menu and the inviting patio is all it took for me to chose this location for dinner.  The smoked salmon appetizer is excellent and splitting the Cesar salad was perfect before our dinner. The bacon wrapped pork tenderloin was incredible and perfectly prepared. The potatoes that come with this dish is a must order.  Make sure you leave room for the cinnamon sugar donut dessert.  I will for sure be back next time I'm in the area.

Meh.... Nothing to write home about. And with the plethora of restaurants around I likely won't go back to this one again. Crispy Calamari was only good because it was filled with tempura. Otherwise I didn't really even taste the calamari. My Asian chicken salad was mediocre and my drink was weak.
...went there for lunch today. Realy nice menue. Most awesome lunch in a long time. Very nice service as well.

This is a nice place for a group for sure. You can get a smaller menu so it keeps it easier for them and you. Everything was delicious and the staff was super friendly and knowledgeable. The green goddess salad is delicious and simple so it's a great starter for all types of eaters. I got the Nimi ranch skirt steak and it was awesome! Location is good but it's in an out door mall so it's a little congested and you will have to park and walk some. But it's not too bad. Downside is that the bathrooms are outside and they are public so they are not well kept. Other than that everything was awesome

The boyfriend and I hit The Greene House on a Friday night and it was a great place for a casual, but not too casual,  Friday date.  Even though it was Friday we were able to get seated right away. We decided to get a few things to share, that way we could try a couple different items on the menu.   We started with the mac and cheese with sausage. It's kind of like an adult version of macaroni and cheese with a hot dog. The mac and cheese is tasty - very thick cheese. The sausage is a link served on the side, cut in half which was perfect since we were sharing. The sausage had a little kick to it but was not super spicy. A nice compliment to the cheese.  Next we had the twin Kobe burgers with fries. They put it on two plates so I think we got extra fries which was cool. The burger was delicious. So tender and juicy and had that good burger flavor. They are small like a slider so if we hadn't been getting multiple dishes I could have easily eaten both. The fries were good too, thin and crispy with lighten herbs on them.  For desert we had to try the donut. We are both big donut lovers and this one didn't disappoint. It's an oversized sugar donut served with a large donut hole. Definitely big enough to share. On the side is a vanilla and raspberry cream sauce for dipping. It's kind of like a reverse jelly donut. The donut came out warm and soft and was delicious when dipped in the sauce.  A great choice for dessert when you want something a little out of the ordinary but nothing too weird.  My only complaint about Greene House was the noise. It was very loud in there so it was a little hard to carry on a conversation. The place isn't that big so we were surprised at the noise level. If it hadn't been so hot out we would have sat outside. Oh well, next time.  I would love to go back and try some of their other dishes.
This is probably the only place that I've been to that I have never complaint or had a bad meal! Everything is great here!

This place has something for everyone, and is really lovely. It's fairly pricey, but that's to be expected for its location. Last time I went, I got the salmon salad - it wasn't necessarily what I was expecting. They use butter lettuce which really is delicious, but otherwise it was a piece of salmon on the bed of greens. I suppose it's minimal and healthy, but it didn't warrant the price. There were other really good looking menu items coming out to tables nearby, and the wait staff was fantastic.

Well two for two,  Nice service, exceptional bistro food.  Great day to enjoy outdoor dining in Scottsdale.  Salmon, prepared to perfection. Kobe burger with sautéed onions, crisp thick cut bacon and aged cheddar, YUMM. Caesar and grilled chicken, nice but the attention to detail in the croutons.  Well...You just gotta try em!  We'll be back!

This is probably my favorite spot to eat right now. All of the food is delicious, and refreshing in flavor. When you walk in the ambience is very cozy and romantic. I recommend sitting on the patio during a nice evening, because the lights from the outside add to the feel.  For appetizer the warm Brie is the best! It's very comforting food to enjoy on a cool evening. For entrees my top three are the green goddess salad, French dip, and salmon! You will not regret eating here, the only reason I did not give it three stars is because sometimes waiter to customer ratio is off and you may be waiting for awhile when it comes to getting drinks and order taken. Totally worth it though!

The Greene House is very good. Their atmosphere and outdoor patio is one of the best things about this restaurant. I took my husband there for his birthday & had the Fresh Pasta & Shrimp - soo good! The only thing my husband didn't like so much was his entree was a somewhat small to medium sized portion for a grown man.

Sent to dinner with 2 vendors from out of state.  We sat outside, covered patio with heaters. We were intermittently hot and cold but it was not too unpleasant.  Food: very very good!!!  Had the braised short ribs, sampled the chicken pot pie and trout. Also very nice Drinks, alcoholic very good.  No dessert  Service was very good.  I would happily go here again.   Great location. Priced accordingly in the KierlandCommons. Free Covered parking garage
Little bit pricey but the food is really good. Especially the braised short rib. If you like old fashions try theirs it's also tasty!
Excellent salad. Chicken enchiladas not traditional, which I loved not too cheesy. Had lots of veggies. Great flave.

After a nearly eight year hiatus, I returned to Scottsdale for a short trip and my first stop, after baggage claim, the car rental pick up and checking into my hotel, was dinner at The Greene House.    Since it had been so many years, I read some of the more recent reviews and was excited to see that nothing had changed, outside the common theme that the entrees were expensive.  I had a very enjoyable meal, which consisted of a melted brie appetizer, chicken and prosciutto ravioli and an apple tart for dinner.  My entire meal was $35 for three courses, hardly expensive.  A Bentley is expensive, a three course meal at $35, using quality ingredients is a bargain.

Have dined here twice. Once for dinner and the other lunch. Dinner was the first. The service was ok.. Not the friendliest waiter, but not the worst either. The food was good but nothing I would go out of my way to have again. Lunch was better. The tortilla soup is amazing. By far the best I've had in a long time. My salad was good as well. The service was much better. Very nice waiter, polite and very professional. My only criticism is the service was rather slow. It took forever or 2 salads. It was busy, but not enough to justify a 20 minute delay. We had to ask for the check the same time the salads finally arrived. If you have meeting or a scheduled lunch period, I would not suggest this restaurant. But would be great for dinner or a weekend when you have no time frame!
Not many vegetraian options.  You have to like fish to eat here.  I was surprised at how fish heavy the menu was, especially with a name like Greenhouse.  Food was tasty though.

This place is much busier than Zinc and the waiting area was packed. My wife has been here before and this was my first time. She ordered red wine and I had a Coors lite. I had the fish and chips along with a lettuce wedge salad which was one of the best I've had. It had avocado, hard boiled egg sliced in half, bacon bits and sliced red onion. Yummy, hit the spot. The fish was Rock fish and came with coleslaw, catsup, tartar sauce and French fries. The fish was nicely battered and a slight greasy, not enough to turn you off. My wife ordered the Braised Short Ribs which was tender and packed full of flavor. I'll order that the next time we visit this great restaurant. Our server was polite and knew his menu and was also attentive.

Great as always. We think the menu change is always fun and the service is the best. Our drive is 50 minutes but worth it every time. The Fox Resturant Group has it down concerning what people are looking for in a good meal.

Six of us had dinner here and ordered a variety of dishes. All the food was visually appealing and everyone seemed to enjoy what was ordered. I ordered the Kobe burger, however, I don't think it was actually Kobe. This just tasted like regular hamburger. I've had a number of Kobe burgers at other restaurants, and they have a distinctive taste, unlike this one. Service was good, but I don't remember her offering desserts. Maybe she just wanted to turn the table, don't know?  Overall, I expected more from this place.

In town for some meetings and a little fun. This place is a short walk from the Westin Kierland. We had aa wonderful dinner there. Guided by Mel, one of the best servers we have ever encountered. He patiently walked us through the menu, asked questions about our tastes and then made his top recommendations. All were spot on.  Kale salad. Hands down the best ever Pork tenderloin. Cooked to perfection, large portion And finally this chocolate desert that was amazing. Can't remember what it was called but just ask and they will know.  Looking forward to our next visit next time we are in town

Asked the waitress about the filet.   She said it was "ok", but that I should  try the short ribs as they were outstanding.   I told her I made really good short ribs, so I wasn't sure about ordering those.     She said trust her, their short ribs were amazing and if I didn't love them she would take care of it.    Sure enough, the short ribs were tough, over-seasoned, and simply not near amazing.   When the waitress asked how my meal was, I gave a very blasé "ok".    She muttered to herself, hmmm, I guess you didn't like them and walked away.    I maybe can excuse that, as I did say they were "ok", but given her prior comments and the fact that my meal was less the half eaten....     Overall, I found the service lacking and food, well, "ok."

As one of the Fox Restaurants, you know quality and price point go hand in hand.  We've been here several times and have yet to be let down.  Something small, yet noteworthy... don't be afraid to ask the chefs for something special.  Something as simple as "Can you do something to spice up the Mac N Cheese...?"  And they come back with some siracha-infused bowl of awesomeness...  HELL YEAH!!  Thanks Greene House!!

Sarah was one of the friendliest and most helpful servers I have come across at any restaurant. She did a great job. Good suggestions and timing.  The food was good, not great. The tempura vegetables with the calamari were good but the calamari was bland and a bit rubbery. The sauce was odd.  The French dip had some good (nice horseradish sauce, au jus was rich and salty) and some meh (the bread was too soft and kind of dissolved in the au jus). Husband enjoyed his tuna tacos.  Drinks were interesting. The sangria was good but didn't taste like a sangria or wine at all. Paloma was fresh and summery but needed more tequila.

We have been in Scottsdale for the past week and ate here twice - both meals (one lunch, one dinner, same menu and prices for each) were great, just spot-on.   I tried a basil gimlet and the salmon bruschetta - both lovely.  Scallops perfectly cooked, and my wife loved her chinese chicken salad. The next time, we had "pea dumplings" - wonderful little morsels in a broth we wanted to lick up, and we split both a beet salad and mahi tacos - oh yeah and I had a fantastic pomegranite margarita.  We were tempted to stay all afternoon...  If I am ever back in this neck of the woods, I would look forward to dining here again!

While staying in the area we stopped in here for happy hour.  We got there around 4PM and the place was nearly empty, but within an hour it got packed.  The have a really nice wine menu with most options available in 4 increments from a glass to a bottle, which makes it nice to only buy the portion you might be interested in trying.  They appetizer menu looked really nice so we tried the calamari and the hummus.  Both were outstanding!!  The hummus was out of this world, with fresh cucumbers and feta mixed in and something spicy in it as well.  We really enjoyed this!  Their calamari was unlike any we've had before.  It was tossed lightly in tempura batter, along with carrots, green beans, onions and mushrooms and all of that was fried together.  They all tasted amazing on their own, but the shoyu (Asian sauce) that came with it really added an amazing kick!  Overall, we really enjoyed this place and recommend it!!
Best pineapple upside down rum cake also their fresh donuts are amazing, good place to go for lunch or dinner everyone is so friendly and food is fresh.

Awesome visit. It was my first time by my wife's second. We already had dinner elsewhere but she insisted we crossed town for their dessert.   We were seated promptly on the patio. It was pretty busy in the dining room. Our mission was to have the chocolate bars of sin.  Even though we were there just for dessert, our sever was excellent and very attentive. We paired the dessert with some Riesling. OMG - wow, loved the dessert and the music coming from the band playing in the open area a short walk away. Total bill was about $16.  I can't wait to come back and try their entrees.

A lovely spot for lunch. The patio is just perfect with the weather cooling off. People watching and fresh air. Our food was fresh and tasty and the service fast and friendly. I can recommend the smoked salmon bruschetta, grilled vegetables and noodles, mac and cheese with Italian sausage and the green tea. After a lovely meal....we had the added bonus of $15 off...received during a dinner at North (the restaurant next door....also very good)....after we realised we were dining at a Fox Concept Restaurant. Lovely lunch spot.

My dinner companions enjoyed the sea bass and pork medallions. The pork medallions were the best meal my companion ever had. I was disappointed with the short ribs. The meat was fork tender and delicious. The entree was drenched in an overly salty sauce. The entree skimped on the cheese grits. I cannot recommend this signature dish.

This is our family's go-to dinner restaurant. They have great food that matches the varied taste of all our family members. I highly recommend adding scallops to the beet salad if you're less hungry, or getting the scallops or the pot roast entrees if you're on the mood for a bigger meal. We also usually get the tempura calamari with veggies, which is perfectly crisp and served with a light sauce.
My go to place when I am at Kierland.  Love the warm brie.  The fresh pasta with shimp may sound innocuous, but don't be fooled it may be the best thing on the menu.

Service was excellent, I ordered the chicken breast and I dont think it was really that great - the chicken was either undercooked or not a great quality unfortunately. $21 for a low quality dinner with small portion- But the service was excellent. I might come back to try something else.

Server - Sarah  Service - 5 star - Sarah is ON it.  Loved her.  What would we order again -  Crab and Avocado Salad although I hate the jar they put this in.  You lose some of the good stuff on top because the bottom of the jar is wider than the top.  I'm not eating the felled pieces from the table top. Kobe Burger Kale and Roasted Corn Salad  What I wouldn't order again -  Tortilla Soup - It's good.  I'm just not a huge tortilla Soup person.  This is a brothy Soup and I'm more of a creamy Soup person.

We were here on the very busy Valentine's Day - not only was the food incredible, but the service was top notch as well.    My husband got the braised short rib and I got the kale salad and the homemade pasta.  I loved both of my dishes.  The kale salad had a great amish cheddar vinaigrette and the grapefruit slices complimented the salad perfectly.  I also loved the handmade pasta and thought that the simple dressing with melted tomato and spinach was perfect and really highlighted the handmade pasta.    But really the highlight was the impeccable service.  My husband and I were sitting on the patio, which was gorgeous, however, there was a couple next to us who started smoking.  Since I'm nine months pregnant, we decided to wrap up our meal quickly.  I headed inside to wait while my husband asked for our food to be boxed and paid our bill.  Shortly after that the manager approached us, found us an inside table, and offered us dessert on the house.  I'm really impressed that they were so accommodating on one of the busiest days of the year.  Thanks Greene House!

Have been coming here for years- with friends, family, this restaurant is great for everyone and is always so so delicious. I have never had a bad experience here! This place is a definite must - great location and even better food & drinks! I recommend the artichoke cheese fondue appetizer and any of the salads- the chicken with tomato purée and creamed corn is to die for. Also any of the desserts especially the doughnuts literally melt in your mouth! 5 stars if I could I would give it more.

We visited The Green House quite bit in the past, however, our last few experiences have really not been up to par. I rarely Yelp something bad unless the experience happens multiple times and that is certainly the case here as well.  Bottom line, this place has gone way down hill. The service the last few visits has been less than great and the food was pretty average. They are quite often out of items on the menu, and the food is bland and unremarkable. Frankly, there are so many other excellent places to eat in the area I doubt we will ever return. The only item with much merit on the menu, in my opinion, in the Beet Salad.
Yum!!! Great salads and service is amazing! Wonderful for brunch and lunch with girlfriends!
Discovered this place during Arizona Restaurant week.  The food was extremely good.  The place is small and gets a bit noisy but the the short ribs make it worthwhile!

Had an excellent evening here. I had the fish and chips after numerous great reviews and it didn't disappoint (and that's coming from a Brit)! Head Office found a gluten free dish and we had hummus to start, which was also as good as the reviews.  Desert menu was not very interesting at all

I came here for lunch with a coworker on a weekday a little after noon. The place was packed! I was also very surprised/glad that we easily found parking. Tables are a little cozy close together but wasn't an issue however it was a little loud.   The service was fast! The server told us this concept is a Asian inspired California cuisine. We started with the Smoked Salmon and Oh. My. God. If you come here, get it! Best thing I've tasted in a while! I got the Asian chicken salad which was phenomenal! Very glad we checked this place out.

I like how "California" has become restaurant code for "portions that are made for actual people, rather than gigantic monsters." Everything on our inaugural visit to The Greene House was flavorful and thoughtful, and it didn't make me want to be wheelbarrow'd out of there!  Every time I'm in Kierland I note how this place (like most Fox RCs) is busy and say I need to try it. I'm glad we did, and I can see why it's so popular! The interior is comfy and welcoming and makes you want to just stay a while.   We started with the hummus, which had my favorite mode of transportation for dip-to-mouth: grilled pita. Char marks just make everything taste so much better. The herby feta/tomato topping was a tasty touch. For entrees, I chose the fresh pasta (they had me at "melted tomatoes") while boyfriend chose the crispy half chicken. Both plates were a perfect dinner portion and really delicious. The tomatoes, spinach and cheese of my obviously prepared in-house pasta sound basic, but were executed in a sublime way. I know I'm waxing poetic about a simple pasta dish, but I really wish restaurants would understand the "less is more" way of operating. Boyfriend said his food was delicious, and I stole a bite of the creamed corn--whoa!!  Since you're not shoved into a food coma here, you get to try dessert! One word: doughnut. Do it. Warm, sugary/cinnamony doughnut (with doughnut hole!), side of two dipping sauces. Oh, those dipping sauces? Some sort of vanilla cream concoction and a strawyberry jam situation. Done. Devoured. MAGIC!  I'm really glad The Greene Room is close to home. It's outstanding!

Upon arrival, despite observing many open tables (both inside and out), we were told it would be a 20 minute wait. We asked about the open tables (ie- were they all reserved????). No answer was provided by either of the two hostesses but we were now advised we could be seated outside right away (odd, right?). Immediately after being seated, we noted that all the patio misters faced outward, misting the sidewalk only. None of the tables on the patio are misted so the patio is absolutely unbearable in the July early evening (7PM). We opted to instead wait at the bar for an interior table. The hostess was advised and could easily see us at the bar as we sat just a few feet away from her, in her clear view. After waiting almost an hour (!!!!!!), all the while noting that most of the tables remained open throughout this time (while the hostesses chatted among themselves), we asked how much longer we would have to wait for a table. The hostess immediately responded "your table is now ready". The table she was bringing us to had been open the entire time we waited! WTH?! Then, while heading to the table, I slipped on a wet spot on the floor (spilled water??) and fell, hard, falling first on my knees, then my thigh and finally hit my mouth/head. While falling to the floor, I dropped my martini which shattered, pieces lodging in my leg. For the record, I want to note that I only sipped about 1/4 of my fruity martini during our long bar wait so I was not inebriated nor was I in a state of being unsteady for any reason. The bartender can attest to this as my family and I were chatting throughout our wait. The floor was wet and I went down which has resulted in a very bruised thigh, a bruised/swollen lip with internal cuts, welts on my arm, and three glass cuts on my calf. A man ( the Mgr??? No idea...) came over and helped me up and then proceeded to busy himself with cleaning up the glass. The hostess asked if I was ok, joked that my fall looked like it happened in slow motion, and then she proceeded to sit me down at the table which was covered with glass shards and martini. I told her I thought I was ok (I wasn't...I was dazed to be honest as it was a hard fall to my face). My 21 year old daughter then stepped in and advised that our sitting at a glass shard table was unacceptable and asked that we be moved to another table in a different area. The Manager never introduced himself, never came over to check on me, never asked me what happened, never offered me a band aid/something to clean up the blood on my leg, never asked me to fill out a claim form (to protect the restaurant and have the incident on record), and never even offered to replace the spilled drink. NOTHING. Even worse (if it could get worse), we waited 10 minutes and NO ONE came to our table to service us. The server in the area waited on the two tables on either side but did an excellent job ignoring us. Needless to say, we got up and walked out. I  have never been treated so poorly at any commercial establishment/restaurant in my entire life. Has anyone at this establishment been trained? Their customer service is appalling and the Manager is inept. I am the CFO in the hospitality industry and my company owns/operates 3 restaurants. If this Manager, the hostesses and the server worked on our team, they all would be fired. It has been 5 days since my fall and I am still bruised and I am still in pain. Shame on everyone involved at the Greene House. Your total lack of human compassion is unacceptable.

We went here on Sunday for to celebrate a birthday.  We saw and liked the menu and picked this place.  Well, nothing to write home about and no creativity what so ever in any of the foods plus very small portions for the entrees.  My friends had salads which was just okay nothing great about them just average - the Cheescake factory has much better salads and they are located right down the street.  We love Brie, so we ordered the brie appetizer which was just okay nothing wow.  Picazzo's in scottsdale has a much better brie app.  I had the ricotta gnocchi with sweet potatoes which were hard and it was bland, not creative and just basic.  Nothing to rave about at all, the food was just okay not worth the price tag and we will not be going back.  I like food which tastes good, not something with no flavor. .  avoid this place if you want real good food.

Second visit here. This time, we tried the yellowtail sashimi to start and it was super yummy. The ponzu sauce complimented it perfectly. We loved it so much, we forgot to grab a picture.  I'm skeptical when it comes to raw fish of any type but still enjoy a good ahi tuna, Chilean sea bass and shark as well as good sushi. I don't like fishy tasting fish and this was not that. Really good. Texture like a noodle. For entrees, we ordered the braised short ribs and the chicken ravioli. The hubby like the ravioli quite well, I could have passed, but it was good nonetheless. The braised short rib had a buttery flavor and melted right in my mouth. All the veggie pairing were well chosen and the aged cheddar grits were some of the best we've ever had. Yummy!  Will come again.

We've always loved The Greene House and frequented it when we lived in Scottsdale. We've since moved to Southern California but return every year. This year, we were traveling with friends and were excited to take them to some of our favorite spots. Kierland was close to the hotel we were staying at and it's a nice area to walk around. We were traveling with our two young children but came early and since it was a holiday weekend in summer, the restaurant was not crowded.   We were seated quickly. The waiter kindly offered to take our daughters' order and bring bread for them to munch on while we looked over the menu. My three year old started munching on the bread and my husband split a piece of the bread in half for my other daughter. Much to his surprise, there was a rubber band inside! We immediately called the waiter over who apologized, took the bread away, and sent over the manager. The manager explained that they don't make the bread there, he would have a talk with the bakery and apologized profusely.   Our kids' food (mac and cheese) was brought out so quickly that it was before the adults had even had their order taken. I mean, not the most ideal situation, but since everything else had been expedient, we figured it was no big deal. We asked about specials and the waiter joked they had rubber band - which kind of rubbed us the wrong way - and then said there were no specials.   Our kids were done eating within moments. Our food probably took another twenty to thirty minutes. By then, the kids were ready to leave. They're 4 and 3 and so timing the food to come out early is only helpful if the rest of the food is delivered quickly.  The manager had offered to comp desserts to make up for the rubberband bread and we  had accepted. We decided to ask them to box up the desserts so as to get the kids out of the restaurant. He obliged and we headed out.   When we got back to our hotel, and I unpacked the desserts so we could all eat, I realized that not only did he pack any plastic utensils - he packaged up multiple ice cream desserts (IN PHOENIX! IN SUMMERTIME!) for us to take. The packages were covered in melted ice cream and although some of them might have been tasty, we had no way of knowing. The waiter never mentioned that the desserts were cold and perhaps it wasn't the best idea? They didn't offer to comp our drinks or anything else instead. They sent us out with desserts that melted.   It was an unfortunate night and sadly, we won't be returning to The Greene House on any of our trips back to Arizona.

I just had dinner here on Sunday night and was blown away. The service was spot on. Ericka was fantastic. We had a reservation for 830, even though they close at 9, but they still treated us like gold! We have a few allergies and dietary restrictions, and Ericka accommodated ALL of them with ease. She knew the menu inside and out, and never was flustered when we asked for something to be changed. We ordered a bunch of appetizers, each of us had a different entree, and everyone was very satisfied. She even heard us talking about the donuts, and had them sent out to us (with some icecream to go) and took care of it since we were celebrating a Bride to be. We all work in the hotel business and want to steal here away to work for us. If you go, ask for her to wait on you, you will not be disappointed. The restaurant is nicely decorated - we sat on the patio. The wine and cocktail list are fun and unique!
Cool outdoor patio, good food, great atmosphere, near shopping. Our waitress was great! The short ribs were divine.

I would never write that the food here is "bad", but it certainly wasn't anything to remember.  The dishes are a bit overpriced for the quality and quantity of food.  If you are looking for a special night out with great food, I'd direct you to NoRTH, which is directly....South of The Greene House, and also owned by Fox.
Great atmosphere and service. Food was spot on with generous portions. Perfect place for a date night or nice dinner out with out being pretentious.

Really great little spot!! It was recommended to us by a friend, and I'm glad we went! The creamed corn is a must order! I ordered the pan roasted sea bass, and I have to be honest it was a bit bland. I had to use table salt, which is rare for me! My husband the French dip and liked it. Service was great! Ambiance great as well.
We went out to the Greene House for dinner.  The skirt steak was phenomenal.  From the the cocktails to the deserts everything was top notch!

Celebrating my daughter's new job and she always picks Greene House! We love this restaurant. Service is always great, but a little disappointed with my salmon salad tonight. I get this item often and tonight it was dry. :-(. Our waitress was great though and gave me some extra dressing to take with my left overs.  We will still always come back!

I'm sorely disappointed with our experience tonight at GreenHouse. I've been here many times and have had very pleasant meals. But I won't be going back any time soon. Today was my husband's birthday and we hoped for a typically enjoyable meal. Unfortunately it was a disaster. When we sat down we informed the waitress we needed something to go. Could she please get that going when we were finishing our meal. We ordered and after that it was all downhill. First they ran out of the fish my daughter and I ordered. They said one of us would get what what we ordered. The other would get another fish they grabbed from the kitchen at North. When it came they were both the same and no one could tell us what we were eating. My husband's meal did not come until we were half way through with our meals. And then when it finally came it was raw. And it was pork. He didn't get his food until we were done. When the waitress saw our disgust she said she'd send the manager over. Someone came to deliver my husband's food but never identified himself as a manager and said simply we're sorry. We'll comp the entree. Ok. Then when we were having dessert we reminded the waitress of our to go order. She was a deer in the headlights. She had clearly forgotten to put the order in. We waited about 15 minutes but had to get going. When we asked where the food was the waitress said "the kitchen's a mess. It will be more than another  15 minutes". I realize restaurants mess up sometimes but this was one thing after the other. And then the manager, if he really was the manager, should have been  a little more apologetic. Especially when we said it was my husband's birthday. This was very un-Fox like. Their restaurants run pretty professionally. This whole experience left me with a bad taste in my mouth.

This place makes me feel like I've left Az for some reason. The ambiance is nice, can be somewhat romantic at night with dim candles lighting up the patio. The waiter we had was very pleasant and just the right amount of checking up on us. The food was fair, but a bit overpriced for smaller portions and selection is limited. Overall I think it's a cute little restaurant with what appears to some pretty healthy and tasty options and I would recommend.

Outstanding food.  We searched for a place to eat in Kierland Commons without a reservation at 5:45 on a Friday night.  Two other places couldn't seat us; Greene House was able to accommodate us on the patio when explained that we just wanted appetizers and drinks.  So glad we passed by the other two restaurants.  The service was impeccable.  We all ordered the Chicken Tortilla soup which was delicious and ordered the Tuna Tartare Tacos, and Smoked Salmon.  Expertly prepared.  This is a real winner.  For the quality of food, reasonably priced too.

I want to go back!  My friends and I dropped in spontaneously for cocktails. We loved the atmosphere and after reading the description on here, I can completely agree that it is warm and inviting with a seaside appeal to it.   The service was excellent. We were informed that the tables next to the bar were open searing, so we sat at a table next to the bar and the bartender greeted us promptly and took our orders. We tried the wild berry mojito, an old fashioned, and the eighteen dollar margarita (which is only $11).  We all loved our drinks.   Admittedly, I wanted to come here for the margarita because I was specifically looking for a place that makes them without the sweet, syrup-like mix. It was so good that I had two!    At one point I asked if they did take-out and was delighted to know that they did. I ordered the short rib plate to take home and it was absolutely incredible.   Go here. Your tastes buds will be delighted.

Seriously amazing! So much attention to detail! Thank you to Mel for taking great care of our daughter and her multiple food allergies!! The ambiance is quaint and sweet. The calamari is out of this world ! The tuna tartare tacos are so flavorful!!!! Loved those! The kids enjoyed their meals!!! The French dip was pretty darn great! Wild go back in a heartbeat! Thank you !!

I never knew about the Greene House. Been to the Kierland's many of times but never noticed GH. My son heard about this place and had a lot of friends go here. I wasn't to sure about this place, but anyways we came. The outside seems very inviting with all the outdoor seating. When you first walk in BOOM the bar is right there. Very modern looking with an open kitchen. You can see the cooking preparing all the meals. Interesting.   I've read reviews and figured out the fish and chips isn't very good here so marked that one off my list. Didn't try and trust me on this. So I tried the Kobe Burger. Thick juicy huge burger with lettuce, tomato, thick piece of bacon, American Cheese and thousand island dressing. Very tasty. Enjoyed it. Loved the bun too. Very fresh. My wife ordered the Turkey on Grilled Flatbread. It comes with fries or salad and my wife got the salad. She really enjoyed it. She said the turkey was very tasty and had hummus. She put some of her salad in the sandwich and made it really good. Yum yum.   My daughter ordered the grilled Mahi tacos. They only give you two tacos. So it's really not enough. Fish was cooked really good. Very moist and tasty. She really enjoyed it but really wasn't enough to satisfy her. So beware. My son had the meatloaf. It was covered with a sweet BBQ sauce on top of mash potatoes with grilled vegetables. He loved it. Said he really liked the BBQ sauce. Very moist and had a really good taste. Gobbled it up. Do I have to say anything more about the meatloaf.   I would have to say the service was okay. Not great. Took awhile to take our order and get our food out but the food was worth it. I guess you have to be careful what you order here. It could be a hit or miss. We all enjoyed our meal so it was a hit with our family. Only thing is the meals were a little expensive. Around $14 a plate. I understand the cost since it's in the Kierland's. You pay a little higher premium when dining at the Kierland's. Good food and a nice atmosphere to enjoy a nice meal in the Kierland's. Enjoy.
Nicole the manager was awesome! Pork tenderloin was one of the best!!!  I definitely would return when I'm back in town!

It's fresh and light yet super filling. Taste was delicious and much different than previous FOX restaurants I've been to. Brother really enjoyed the pork filet dish? which came decently sized and filled him up. I stuck with a salad that needed a LOT of work on presentation but their garlic truffle fries definitely made up for it. Also...their tacos for appetizer...fat siblings for the win.

Our fave restaurant - pasta , scallops and ravioli rock ! Appetizers- have the tuna tartare tacos , or the hummus . Dessert don't miss the bars of sin Great ambience , friendly folks it's a wonderful place

Always a good meal here. I have probably been here around 5 times and been able to try new things each time. The crispy chicken, bbq pork tenderloin, sea scallops, short rib and chicken & proscuitto ravioli are all tasty. They each have a very unique flavor to them.   They also have some great appetizers like their smoked brie. My absolute favor thing on their menu is the tuna tartare tacos. They come with 3 tacos and they are excellent! Almost every time I have gone I order them as an app.   The restaurant itself is nice, nothing special, but they do have an area where you can eat outside, which is a nice change.

Excellent Yellowtail appetizer and chicken enchiladas. Great atmosphere and food experience. Service at 12noon was slowed by a large crowd but it's better to be busy than empty at lunchtime. Patience is worth every bite.

It's a good thing that the food here was decent; otherwise this place would have gotten zero stars.  I went here with 3 other people and was told that we'd have a 20 minute wait. After those 20 minutes were up and we still weren't seated, someone told us that the high top tables were first come, first serve, so we decided to sit there instead. BIG MISTAKE! Once we sat down, we were basically ignored and had to flag down our waitress anytime we needed anything. After we ordered our food, it took nearly 45 minutes to get our meal, which, after all of that, was completely wrong. At least one thing on everyone's plate was incorrect, and when we asked what took so long, instead of just apologizing, our waitress AND the manager both had two excuses that made absolutely zero sense. The first one was, "Well, Scottsdale Quarter is closed". (It wasn't). And the second one was, "We were trying to locate french fries". (I still can't stop wondering what that means, but it was a good thing they did end up "locating" them because they are the reason this review gets its 2 stars and they were delicious). Not only did they make up those strange excuses, but they were 0% apologetic for anything and basically refused to acknowledge that they had done anything wrong. They gave us a coupon for a free appetizer on our next visit which I'm sure won't be used.

love the greene house. flavorful california style cuisine, moderately priced. the sandwiches are great with ample portions. the fries are delicious fresh shoestrings.  must try, the chicken tortilla soup...in any weather! it's more filling than it seems.  also the hummus appetizer with flabread...also filling.  the spicey chicken sandwich is pretty delicious.

We have had good experiences here before.....but this time, they would not seat a party of 4 three minutes after closing time.  We went down the street to Zinc Bistro who said no problem.........sure you can dine with us!
