My parents live nearby and like this place so we figured to enjoy the pleasant weather after completing some errands. To that end, we grabbed a bar table next to a large open window and a shortened our wait. Decent atmosphere overall in Greene House, but the food was underwhelming. I wouldn't return.   The calamari disappointed everyone - at least half of the dish was fried vegetables! I'm ok with sweet potatoes and green beans, but not in place of calamari. My burger was overcooked to well done though I'd asked for medium. Additionally, the bun could not hold its own and disintegrated. The fries were decent at least.   My parents liked their soft tacos and salad, the latter of which was tossed without an excessive amount of dressing. That's a plus for any restaurant in a shopping complex.

Recently popped in for a spur-of-the-moment dinner, mostly because it's right around the corner, and happy to have the Greene House as a neighbor!  Love the ambience, and open feel of the restaurant, especially with the open wall to the outside. The great weather this week obviously helped, not sure how comfy that can be in the summer, but we enjoyed the fresh air. And might I mention the people watching - if you like a lot of stretched-tight skin in various places.  Also, I always seem to like a nice restaurant with the open kitchen that seems to be part of the restaurant. All it needs is a screaming Gordon and I'd feel like I'm in Hell's Kitchen. And I mean that in a good way. I love to see the flames of the various dishes being cooked.  Drinks were good, had a perfectly made dirty martini, albeit a little on the small side. For an appetizer, we ordered the warm brie. It came with perfectly toasted bread, sour cherries and garlic. Mixing all 3 onto the bread seemed like the perfect threesome. (Hey, minds out of the gutter please, I'm talking about the brie)  Entrees - I had the chicken and prosciutto ravioli which were delicious, however I would have liked more prosciutto taste and less chicken. Almost had no prosciutto-y flavor. Still loved it, but I do love me some thin italian meat. (geez, will you stop with the snickering?)  The other dishes ordered at our table were the Seared Ahi Tuna which comes on a bed of stir-fry veggies that I was told was mouth watering, and the roast beef sandwich with fontina cheese. I asked my wife how it was, and all I got was a wide eyed nod as if she didn't want to even open her mouth to waste one taste.  And my little one devoured the mac-n-cheese, penne type pasta drenched in melted cheese, topped with parmesan. (also available with grilled andouille sausage).   And kudos to the GH for the meal size. I love a meal where you finish full, but not stuffed. Everything was the perfect size. Service was great with plenty of attention without being annoying. We didn't leave room for dessert, but the warm cinnamon and sugar donut with vanilla custard sounded very tempting. I just wanted to be able to walk out of the restaurant under my own power...

We have been to The Greene House many times with outstanding service.     But today we took a seat at the bar for a beverage and a light bite.  The bartender (tall male) ignored us for over 10 minutes.  There were other people at the bar but it wasn't full.  Not even a look from the bartender or the bar back that was also behind the bar.    The couple sitting next to us couldn't believe it.  They were trying to get someone's attention along with us.  That couple just shook their heads when we walked out.

Had a great lunch at Green House today, and sat outside on the perfect day.  The service was very good and the food was fantastic.  We had the ahi tacos for appetizer and they were very good.  I had the fresh pasta and shrimp for lunch and it was fabulous.  The shrimp were jumbo prawns broiled beautifully and the pasta was fresh and delicious.  Others in my party had the Green House Salad and the mahi-mahi fish tacos and they both loved it.  I definitely recommend the Green House for a great lunch.

I have to say I have been to this restaurant many times and I always leave happy.  The food is always good, the staff is always very nice and on point. Tonight the manager came over to the table to let us know our food was just being played and will be on the way shortly, which I thought was incredibly nice. I don't believe any of us felt we had been waiting a long time so that was just a nice "little extra" step that I think adds to the experience when going out.    I had the scallops with caramelized cauliflower and bacon it was delicious and just enough. My mom had the meatloaf and she loved it and my dad had the Kobe beef burger and said it was perfect. Our server then recommend dessert and we normally wouldn't do that, but decided to tonight and let me tell you it did not disappoint! We had a  sugar doughnut which they put the doughnut hole on top and serve with 2 dipping sauces 1 is a vanilla bean and cinnamon (I believe) and one is a fruit purée.. This was outstanding! Very light and not oily at all! It was the perfect end to a great dinner.

Good but not great. Last night was our first time at The Greene House. It was a 25% off Labor Day promotion that drew us in. We'd made a reservation requesting outside seating but the hostess "didn't notice" that so we waited and additional 10 or 15 minutes. Our server was friendly and enthusiatic about the menu. We ordered The Greene House Salad, Chicken Potstickers, Sea Scallops and the Horseradish Potato Gratin (SALTY but tasty enough). All were good - but not great. We tried the warm cinnamon donut with custard & betrirs6for dessert. That was quite good and maybe worth a return trip but otherwise, we felt there are much better restaurants for the money - especially in the Scottsdale/Phoenix area. It didn't help to see the Manager stop at THREE separate tables to issue apologies for unsatisfactory food. We had no problems like that - there was just nothing SO good that made us want to come back. One particular distraction was the music on a tinny sound system. The choice of music really sets the tone of a place for us and we thought a "California" influenced theme called for some contemporary Chill music or similar. We likes the songs we heard - they just didn't add to the atmosphere.  We wanted to love it but again, it was just ok. If the prices were slightly lower, it might be worth returning but frankly, North (just around the corner) is the better Fox Concepts Restaurant in that area.

The calamari is fab.  My wife liked her trout dinner a lot?   My fish and chips were very average.  The reason for the two stars is that this large restaurant shares on out door rest room with Restaurant North.  It is way too small for both places and in the 10-15 times I have been there it is filthy, out o.f soap, out of drying paper and usually has paper and trash all over the floor.  After all the years these places have been open I can't  believe this still exists. Sam Fox needs to get .on this.  It is disgusting!

A solid "A". We thought it was great. We (a family of four including 16 and 13 year-old daughters) were in town for spring break in late March and decided to try the Green House as our "farewell vacation dinner".  The hostess staff was a little unorganized but after getting seated the waitress (Jamie) was great and the food was outstanding. We had the scallops, bacon-wrapped pork tenderloin, beef rib, and the house-made pasta dish. All were outstanding. One member of our party has an allergy to nuts and the staff was more than accommodating - the chef even prepared a special order of warm chiabatta bread that was safe to eat as the regular house bread was made off site.  We would definitely recommend the Greene House and will go there again next time we're in Scottsdale.

We had a girls day lunch here and it was Ok. I got a salad and it was alright. My big complaint is that they 1) didn't have a "kids menu" - but  the waitress told me what the choices were and 2) the kids meal was more expensive than my own entree salad!! How can you seriously charge $11 for a kids meal?! We've been to really nice, high end restaurants that don't even charge that for kids. The restaurant is loud and you have to walk outside to even get to a restroom (which was dirty, with a long line (only 2 stalls for two restaurants that are connecting to it). I don't think I'll be back to this restaurant in the future. I was really turned off about the lack of kids menu and the crazy price for the kids meal!

Sometimes a girl just needs a salad! And when that time comes, I love the salads at The Green House. Situated right amongst the fabulous shops in Kierland, The Green House is perfect lunch spot during a shipping trip. I really loved the wine list too, the Pinot Grigio went perfect with the Kale salad I ordered. The service was super fast and very friendly. Definitely recommended!

ate here as i was starting to"eat healthy" so i got the grilled chicken breast sandwich and it was actually really good.   we got seated pretty quickly and everyone seemed to enjoy the food they ordered

Another fabulous Fox Restaurant to check off my list. As noted by a previous reviewer, my thoughts were that The Greene House means a salad/healthy restaurant. Not really the case, but amazingly delicious food, a good lunch splurge. I work close to Kierland and wanted a tasty lunch spot for myself and a few coworkers, one coming in from out of town. Lunchtime parking is a bit of a drag in the area if you don't want valet.  Because it's a Fox Restaurant, I kind of have expectations for service to be on point. It was just a-ok, because it took awhile to be greeted, given drinks and food, and provided the bill. Despite that, we had a wonderful meal. Our threesome ordered the brie as an appetizer, and it was delicious, enough for each of us to have a snack before our salads. Their kale salad was amazing because I added chicken in addition and the mixed dressing wasn't too much [normally I order dressing on the side for all salads]. Probably one of the best salads I've ever eaten in my life. As suggested by our server, we ordered 2 desserts to share - the vanilla panna cotta and the pineapple cake. Loved both, but my hats off to the panna cotta, the red sherbert on top took it over, and getting both on a spoonful was just amazing.
It was really good. I ate the pasta. It was a little on the salty side, but other than that I liked it. It was creamy and the noodles tasted fresh. The service was quick. I like the decor.

My new favorite place in Kierland commons for lunch!! It was hard to choose what entree to get because they all sounded delicious. Ordered the seared scallops and they came out perfect. You get 4 large scallops and the vegetables that come with it are super accomodating and fresh.

Food was fabulous. Service not so much. It was busy however, our server, Mel, needed a personality injection. It doesn't take much to be friendly. Didn't even welcome us or give his name. I had to ask and seemed almost negative to give it to me.   Next time maybe we'll get to sit outside.

We had a nice evening thanks to the accommodating and attentive staff.  Our food was delicious including the scallops (never enough!), the pot pie devoured by hungry hubby (satisfied his big appetite too), guest's fish taco plate with beans he loved, daughter downed her pork loin with potato gratin (nice portion size, enough to stuff), and the horseradish potato gratin I could eat every day, mmmm. We shared a kale salad and it was about as good as it can be, being that it is a kale salad.  Craft beer selection needs a boost, but overall we had a great experience.

Cute little spot i Scottsdale.  The food is fresh.  The service is pretty good.  It can get crowded pretty easily though.  It's basically a twist on American classics.  The mac and cheese is absolutely delish and the real stand out dish in my mind.  I literally love mac and cheese and could eat it almost every day.

We love this boutique restaurant, just wish there was an Orange County store! Every time we're in Phoenix, we make sure to eat here. Tonight I had the grilled beet salad with a side of wonderful grilled asparagus. Magnifique!! Our server, Lexi was great, too.
Wasn't my favorite fox concept Resturant but it was decent. Really enjoyed the hummus appetizer and the burger was also tasty. Staff was awesome and friendly!!

The Greene House hit the spot last night- its hard to get hubby to try new places and honestly we've been budget conscious about going out to eat lately, so we really want to make sure we'll go someplace we'll really enjoy. Luckily, hubby liked it, and we were happy with our experience.  I only give this place 4 stars because they aren't kid friendly (a little pricey and no kids' options on the menu), and the service was pretty slow, but even at that, the server was very friendly. We sat out on the patio as the sun was going down- the place had a nice atmosphere and it was just nice to sit, people watch and enjoy the weather. We started with the herbed hummus and I got the twin Kobe burgers with fries- they were pretty decent, nothing out of the ordinary. However, hubby got the mahi tacos and they were outstanding, as was the side of mac cheese we got for my son.   I don't think I'd order the same food, but I would definitely go again for a date night!

We found this place because it was within walking distance of the Westin Kierland Resort (http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-westin-kierland-resort-and-spa-scottsdale) and because it's under the Fox Restaurant umbrella.  By coincidence, we had been thinking about trying Fox's Montana Avenue restaurant when we were in Tuscon (http://www.yelp.com/biz/montana-avenue-tucson), which has an identical menu.  Normally we don't do chains, but we we decided to give this place a try.  We started with the ahi tuna tacos, in part because some of the proceeds when to feed the hungry in Scottsdale.  A tasty choice.  We then split two entrees, the mini Kobi burgers (w/ fries), and the chicken and prosciutto raviolli w/ peppers.  Both were quite good, with the thin cut fries being unexpectedly excellent.  The house margarita and the Zinfandel from Paso Robles were also nice.  Honestly, for what my girlfriend calls "upscale pub food", you're not going to get much better.
Went here and we all got Kobe burgers and truffle fries. They were da bomb! Great service and ambiance as well on the patio.

My husband and I love stopping here for lunch or dinner. Every menu item we have had has been delicious! Service is great, and it's right in the middle of some amazing shopping. The perfect day date: shop a little and stop in for lunch! They have healthy options and pricing is on point. Outdoor seating is lovely with the misters on! Dinner can get a little busy especially on weekends, we usually snag a quick seat at the open bar to avoid waiting.

I was at this place for a work party. I would say overall the good was good, and the service was quick. It was hard as a large party at a long straight table and half the party was on a bench and the other half in chairs. This made it difficult for people to get up. Overall its a good place. Its not my normal type of place to go. I am glad I went once, but probably would not return on a regular basis.
Delicious food, clean and attractive dining area, friendly staff. Minus one star only for noise level.

Went here in the afternoon one day with my mom for lunch. The place is usually busy every time i've walked by but there is a lot of seating so waiting for a table usually isn't that big of a deal. My mom and I didn't have to wait at all thankfully. We sat outside because it was nice out. The have misters and covered shading for the outside seating so that makes up for the weather part. The service was okay. Our waiter was not great on checking up on us but did check up on us to see if we needed anything. The food was very good though. I got a salad and my mom got a sandwich, both were very good. Besides the somewhat slow service I definitely would come back here again!
Great food and drinks. The pasta shrimp plate was very good. Would order it again. Friendly staff. Clean restaurant and nice patio. All of our group enjoyed it all.

Service was excellent. Really friendly waitress who was very attentive. Had the grilled chicken sandwich and chicken pot pie...both beautifully presented and delicious. We sat outside for lunch - great atmosphere. Will definitely be back!

One of our favorite restaurants! The Scallops are amazing! The other MUST have item on the menu... the Mocha Bars. Oh my goodness, in my top 3 best desserts of ALL time. Their yellowtail sashimi appetizer with avocado, cilantro and jalapeño is also to die for!

Having lived in California for 15 years I find it funny when a restaurant says it serves California fare. What? Beet salad and seared scallops are only available in California. Warm chocolate cake? Only in the Golden State? Hmmm. Well, what's not funny is how much I enjoyed my food and the attentive and outgoing service we had. And I was delighted at how large the portions were. I was expecting scaled down versions for RW. Kristin S, Rickie and I were here for Arizona Restaurant Week (Ah, c'mon who are we kidding, let's just call it Phoenix Restaurant Week!) and had a fantastic time. My roasted beets were sweet and dee lish. While the sauce with my scallops was a bit too sweet for my tastes, they were cooked perfectly. And as luck would have it, it was half off bottled wines! YAY! Kristin and I sipped a wonderul Sauvignon Blanc that matched my entree perfectly. Rickie's Natural Chicken (WTF? Natural chicken? As oppossed to the chickens with silicon breasts? Now that would be very Californian!) was flavorful but since it was served with the skin on, could have been crispier. Not being a fan of rhubarb I was pretty sure I wouldn't like the cobbler. And. Well. I was right. I made that yucky puckery face you make when you wish you could spit out what you just put in. But I swallowed. Like a lady.

went for an early dinner with my honey on saturday.  we normally don't order apps but we we didn't have lunch so we needed something to get us through. we went with the hummus and pita bread and it was so fresh and yummy! server said that it's homemade in house. For my entree I ordered the salmon with mixed veggies and the hubster ordered the crispy chicken and subbed the creamed corn with mashed potatoes, he loved his side of asparagus... smokey flavor.  our server did provide us a lit sample of the creamed corn because he raved how delicious it is. yes the creamed corn was very rich and in my opinion not worth the calories unless you've been good all day.  we both ordered red cabs and we skipped dessert since we were nice and full. enjoyed our meals and the friendly service.

Mediocre at best, we were looking for something new and this place looked good online. The atmosphere was ok in keirland commons, the patio was nice, but other than the appetizers the food was meh. I had the kobe burger for lunch, and it was dry and tasteless. My wife had a turkey wrap which wasn't much better. If you want to eat here just order the artichoke fondue and some drinks.
Nice appetizers / drinks had the mussels / napa valley sangria  Entrees could use more variety pork tenderloin/ fresh pasta is good  Desserts were very good - sorbet

My friend and I have a list of places we want to try and this was on it. We went on a Saturday and had no problem being seated. Our server was great. He helped us with recommendations since it was our first time there. We started off with the Snoqualmie Riesling and it was delish. We then split a salad and a sandwich. The salad was roasted beet and the sandwich was the kobe burger and fries. Both were good and cooked to our specs. I would go again and try some other things on the menu.

I am editing my review. We were there last Wednesday and we had Logan as our server. He did an excellent job and he was so professional and attentive even though it  was packed. As always, our food was delicious.  I always order the hamachi appetizer and the salmon dinner.  It looks like they have made some changes with their hostess stand. Instead of a gaggle of giggling girls playing with their hair, they had one mature efficient hostess with the manager assisting her on occasion. So glad when I see a great restaurant make necessary changes. Can't wait to go back!   I have to tell you that this place almost lost our bi-monthly patronage because of some extremely snotty teenage hostesses.  The first time we thought it was a fluke but tonight was the icing on the cake.  We made a last minute Open Table reservation for a patio table on a Sunday night for 5:45.   We arrived at 5:30 with no wait ahead of us  and at least 2 open patio tables. The 3 young girls at the hostess stand let us know that they could not accommodate our reservation request and they let us know that they left me a voicemail to let me know. My husband asked how long for a patio table. They said emphatically that it would be at least 45 minutes. We said we would go somewhere else and they seemed extremely pleased that they accomplished this. Then as we were walking by the empty tables my husband decided to ask why we couldn't have one of the empty tables. They told him that it was reserved for 7:15!!! They agreed to let us sit at that table.    I will tell you this is the 2nd time we've had an issue with the hostesses. We dine out a lot and the only reason we have come back over and over again after the first "hostess incidence" is because the food is extremely consistent. (I love the sashimi appetizer and the salmon, my husband orders the short rib and our son orders the bacon wrapped tenderloin and we always order a bottle of wine off of the reserve list).   That said, we were glad that we battled the teenagers for a table. Our food was good as always and Sarah was an exceptional waitress. Also, we were done before 7 and that was with an appetizer, a salad, 3 entrees and a nice bottle of wine.   I am pleading with the managers as a loyal customer: PLEASE reevaluate who you hire to greet your guests. We have been frequenting your restaurant for years. My husband works with out-of-state clientele as he is always recommending your restaurant to his clients for delicious food and a fabulous atmosphere. We can not in good conscience recommend your restaurant anymore if the teens in charge of seating are playing control games with your customers.   Please hire a new greeting staff that is more mature and more concerned with customer service than they are with styling  their hair (yes-one young lady was combing her hair into a ponytail and one was arranging her flower halo while scolding us about not having a table for us).   We love Sam Fox and his restaurants and we know his restaurants are very good  (my husband is a college U of A friend of his). We know you can do this! Looking forward to upgrading my review after the problem is rectified. Green House-you have nailed it on your food and your waitstaff but please better train your hostesses!

The truffle fries!!!!!!! I would drive all the way back for these fries. Shared the kale salad with chicken and the 1/2 roasted chicken with the husband. Both meals were incredible. Had a glass of malbec that was :meh: but everything else was wonderful

If I could I wouldn't even give this restaurant 1 star. TONY is the most unpleasant human and I will never step foot in this restaurant again. The way he treated me after a dinner out with my mother and grandmother was just appalling. He stormed to our table after I took a sip of my mothers wine (mind you I am 22 years old) and grabbed the glass of wine out of my grandmothers hand very aggressively. After that he refused to tell me his name and tried kicking me out. Since I was 15 I have worked in the restaurant industry and have never in my life experienced such a disgusting and unpleasant experience. DO NOT GO ESPECIALLY WITH TONY AROUND. On a somewhat positive note, the general manager was pleasant and helped the situation. To be honest I am just mortified with my experience and will never be returning.

Overall this made for a great place for Valentines! A week later and my husband is still saying "that steak was so amazing!" The filet truly was divine. Literally melted in your mouth! The rainbow carrots along with it were cooked to perfection with an incredible sauce. I myself had the bacon wrapped tenderloin which was equally as delicious, I just had entree envy and really wanted the steak!! The sides did leave a little to be desired. The mac & cheese was really plain and it kind of seemed like they just mixed noodles into fake cheese like valveeta. Not my favorite. The dessert completely made up for it though! Their chocolate mocha dessert was out of this world!! I would return for that dessert alone! Chocolate mouse on a bed of chocolatey hazelnut? Just too good to be true!!  Fantastic service! Our server was super wonderful and kind, made us feel welcome and important. I wish I could remember her name!  The ambience was fun and fresh!
Decent food, but overpriced for what it is. You can for sure find better in the Kierland and Scottsdale area. Especially at that price point.  Herb Box for example in Old Town.

I think the Greene House might be my favorite restaurant in the Kierland/Scottsdale Quarter areas. I've dined here a few times or picked up food to go at least every other week. The food is consistently great and service is attentive and friendly.   The Greene House has great mussels, kale salad, sea bass, chicken pot pie, calamari, scallops, and salmon. The panna cotta is a very nice, rich and creamy homage to strawberry shortcake with the garnishes. (You should definitely save room for dessert here!) The drinks are also nicely done - I loved the pineapple mule and the fig mule.   I don't think you can go wrong with a meal at the Greene House - it's nice for dates or for work. The only downside is that there are maybe 2-3 vegetarian options on the menu and I don't think there is anything for vegans - this is the only thing keeping me from coming in more since a lot of my group has some vegan/vegetarian restrictions.

Meh.... I had high expectations for this joint and it sadly didn't cut the mustard.    The staff was very friendly and accommodating to our party, who had changed the reservation size twice and showed up late (oops!  we accidentally went to the Scottsdale Quarter).  My party enjoyed the prix-fixe meals for Restaurant Week.  The appetizers were certainly the highlight here-- baked brie, hummus, and calamari.  Each was tasty, had a unique twist:  the brie was accompanied with garlic and cherries and the hummus was topped with tomatoes, feta, and cucumbers.   The dinner portions were small and sufficient. I personally like salt, so the salty scallop dish didn't bother me.  However, another diner in our group took issues with the overly salty dish.  The chocolate cake was not worth the calories.    I'm a HUGE Fox Concept restaurant fan, but Greene House didn't do it for me.  Go next door (literally) to North or to the Scottsdale Quarter to True Food Kitchen for a better Fox dining experience.

I had the pleasure of being taken here, Mother's Day, and from the greeting at the entrance to the farewell at our conclusion, it was apparent, the Greene House follows the protocols of hospitality.     The restaurant is very aesthetic and the staff, exceptional.  Our waiter was professional and I cannot emphasize enough, enthusiasm and being part of a positive experience makes anything that follows exemplary.  The food from appetizers to desert, was fantastic.  Subtle and complimented flavors, well prepared and, in the case of the pasta dish I enjoyed, enough to share.    A great occasion, experience and memory.
Excellent staff and vast menu (multiple delicious options - picking one dish won't be easy) with Californian inspiration.   Kale Salad and donut dessert - don't miss out on these!

They were very accommodative with our family and found a space for us and our three year old that worked great. Our server Jessica was amazing and food was awesome. Happy to recommend as a date night or even with a family.

Surprisingly, had a great dinner on Wednesday. Went in for a glass of wine and dinner and found out they have half off bottles on Wednesdays. Ended up getting a bottle and their half chicken entree and it was awesome! I say surprisingly because in general, I have generally underwhelmed with Fox Concept restaurants, but this along with North have consistently surprised me. I'll definitely be making another trip here.

Wonderful food. The hummus appetizer was excellent. The entree was great as well. They were more than willing to accommodate some amendments I wanted on the entree. The bartender was fast and friendly. The place itself was very modern and clean.

I'm really surprised at the reviews here. This place is fantastic. A great location. Awesome food.   I've eaten half the menu and everything except the gnocchi has been way above average.   The herb hummus appetizer is great, too.

This is a local favorite.   Service was exceptional, but the menu feels stale.  Had the kobe beget which was excellent.   The calamari was a little on the great side, but the avocado and cream dip looked delicious.
We stopped in for lunch recently and had a great experience! Salads were fresh, hot bread served, and service was very good! Another Sam Fox restaurant that didn't disappoint!

We eat here regularly - it's definitely one of our 'go to' spots in the neighborhood.  The service and food are always consistent and the drinks are particularly good.  If you like a mule, their fig mule is really tasty and served in a copper cup - so it stays super cold until you finish it (as a mule should).  We consistently order the kale salad to start.  it's exceptional.  sometimes I just order it as a main course - it's that good.  For main dishes, we really like the trout and short ribs.  my husband loves their chicken pot pie... but it's BIG and you need to be hungry.  we rarely get dessert since their food is satisfying - but we did have gelato last time that was really great.  Overall... it's just always great.  patio is great seating and the bar is even nice if you're popping in and want a quick bite.

Generally speaking I love most Fox restaurants but I think this one is my favorite of all.  We had good options of wine and cocktails but I was so impressed with the appetizer options I made them my meal.  We shared calimari which was incredibly tasty.  I had tuna tartar tacos for dinner and they were the best possible and I have tuna tartare a lot.  My friends all had a wedge salad and added scallops which was a nice option and the tortilla chicken soup was fabulous.  Absolutely fabulous meal all around finished with an fun donut and custard type dessert we all shared.

Have eaten here many times. Always consistently good food and service. Have a good variety of menu options as well as appetizers and desserts. Staff is always friendly and helpful and willing to give suggestions. This is a fox concept so you kind of know what to expect. They also do a happy hour. If you're in the area and hungry or thirsty definitely come by and check out this spot. Lots of restaurant choices right in the immediate area as well.

This review is for our dining experience on 2/18/17.  I typically do not write reviews unless I have a great experience or a poor one.  This review is the latter.       My wife and I and our two friends made reservations ate the Greene House to celebrate our belated birthdays and our friend's new job.  We made reservations for 6:45p and arrived at the restaurant at 650p.  The hostess informed us that our table was not ready as the previous party was still sitting and talking at said table.  While waiting we had a drink at the bar, pinot noir and their version of the Moscow mule which was very well done.  We waited for approximately 25 mins for them to clear out and clean the table off before being seated at 715p.  Now, I understand it was a busy night and don't expect to be seated right when we walk in the door but a half-hour wait with a reservation is pushing it.     Once seated our waitress arrived promptly, however, she never introduced herself, so I couldn't tell you what her name was.  Everyone at the table had already had their drinks from our wait at the bar, but I ordered an Orange avenue beer that took about 15 minutes to arrive.  We then started off with several appetizers that arrived promptly.  First, we ordered the Yellowtail sashimi and the Tuna Tartare Tacos, both of which were excellent and very flavorful.  We then had the mussels and the calamari.  The mussels were served with grilled ciabatta and their house chorizo and were very tasty as well.  The mussels were also a very large portion and good for sharing.  The calamari was also a good portion size and very good as well.       During our second round of appetizers, were put in for our dinner orders.  My wife ordered the the Mahi-Mahi tacos, I had the Fish and Chips, and our friends had the Braised short ribs and Sea Scallops.  The Mahi-Mahi tacos were very soggy and the white bean salad was served luke-warm.  I had the fish and chips which came with three large pieces of fish and crispy fries.  The fish was flaky and meaty and very tasty.  Our friends both enjoyed their meals as well.  The short rib was very tender and the scallops were seared very nicely.  We also ordered Truffle fries and the Marscapone cream corn to share.  The fries had a good flavor and were very crispy, however, the creamed corn was very mushy and a miss.     Towards the end of our meal, our two friends were still finishing their meals and our waitress came back two times within 15 minutes asking us if we wanted to go boxes  We found it to be rather irritating that we were sat down late and then felt as though we were being rushed out.     And to top off our lackluster experience here, this morning two out of the four of us have felt ill with stomach flu-like symptoms.  Not sure if this was related to the raw fish from the sashimi and the tartare tacos we all had or not but it really caps off an overall poor dining experience, which is a shame because we had great experiences at several other Fox Concepts such as North and The Henry.  Needless to say, I would recommend skipping The Greene House and going to on of the other fine eateries within Kierland Commons.

My family and I stopped here for lunch without looking up any reviews because we were starving. We did not know what to expect, but were pleasantly surprised! We ordered the hummus and the pot-stickers for appetizers. Both were extremely tasty and the pot-stickers come out in a cast iron skillet and are piping hot. Some of us got wedge salads that were extremely tasty and had a very good presentation. The Asian salad was my favorite - light and tasty. My family also said really good things about the chicken club and the turkey on grilled flat bread.  Overall, it was a really good experience and I can't wait to come back to Scottsdale to try round two!

I've been to The Greene House twice and really do love the atmosphere of this restaurant. That wasn't unexpected for me though as it's a Fox Restaurant and those folks have the game on LOCK!   The Greene House is cozy, bright, well-decorated, and airy- very "West Coast". I love it.  One my 1st visit I had the fresh pasta (it comes with spinach, tomato, and parm) and although I had high hopes, I was a little disappointed. The pasta wasn't al dente and was actually somewhat mushy and overcooked. Also it was skimpy on the cheese and that is a cardinal sin in my world. For me, cheese = life.  On my 2nd visit I had the roasted sea bass with potato puree, spinach, broccoli, onion, and lemon vinaigrette. It was absolutely delicious but HOLY TINY PORTION SIZE BATMAN. This itsy bitsy ass portion of sea bass cost $25? Very, very disappointing. I most definitely did not get my money's worth. For about $5 more I could go to Pappadeaux's and get twice this amount of sea bass. And it tastes just as good TBH.  Also, I have to remark that my food came out cold on both visits. That's a huge pet peeve of mine. I will give Greene House a 3rd chance though- the pineapple mango mule drink is to die for!
Love The Greene House. Especially the Sunday special with half off bottles of wine!  The fish + chips is to die for. So so good.  And, just about every single appetizer on the menu is delicious!

This place is unexpectedly great!! I had the braised beef short ribs with cheese grits. Incredible!!! The wait staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. We had a large group and everyone loved their food. I would go back again

Randomly stumbled across the Greene House while Yelping the other night. We couldn't figure out where to go for the night, so while browsing we came across this place and the decent reviews led us to go ahead and give it a shot.   It was a chilly Arizona winter night... but indoor seating was full, so we opted to sit out on their heated patio. When they say 'heated' patio, they aren't kidding... it was toasty out there! In fact the first table we got seated at was so hot we had to move, we were getting a little sweaty after just a few minutes and it was probably in the low 50's outside... so yeah; they have some pretty powerful heaters. Once we moved tables, it was quite relaxing and chill... this place just has a real nice relaxing vibe to it. That, and you can people watch all the yuppies shopping at Kierland as you eat, which is always fun.   We decided on the twin Kobe Burgers (with white truffle and rosemary fries) and the BBQ Pork Tenderloin. While we waited they brought some bread that was pretty tasty. The twin Kobe Burgers came and looked oh so good. The first bite into those things was like heaven in a bun... literally melt in your mouth good. Juicy and flavorful, and they went perfect with the crunchy fries. The Tenderloin was equally yummy... great sauce and crispy around the edges but soft inside; perfectly cooked in my opinion.   Our waiter was also great... very attentive and polite while not being too overbearing. All in all it was a great meal, and I can't wait to go back to this place. 4.5/5.

We attended the New Years festivities so the menu was limited. Even so, Ribeye cap and lamb shank were delicious. Lily was very good and attentive, as was the managerial staff. Look forward to trying this place not during the holidays, particularly for lunch.

My family LOVES Fox Concept restaurants. My dad specifically wanted to try a Fox restaurant we hadn't visited before, and this was close to us at the time, so we visited The Greene House.  The atmosphere here is fresh and pretty -- somewhere I imagine getting lunch with a small group of friends after some light shopping, though my family went for dinner. But I think my expectations for the food were too high. I ordered the bacon-wrapped pork tenderloin because I'm a sucker for both bacon and brussel sprouts, which were both in the description, but was sorely disappointed. The bacon/pork tenderloin were extremely flavorless and lacked any decent texture. The brussel sprouts were pulled apart and used as a garnish. My favorite part of the meal ended up being the potatoes underneath.  Three stars because service was decent and the fondue appetizer was pretty good, but especially for the price point, I won't be going back again.

I loved this place! California inspired at its best.  I had the black mussels and warm brie for appetizer.  I loved the mussels! Super tasty and the chorizo added a nice touch.  Mouth watering as I'm writing.  The brie was ok.  Not that special.  I ordered ginger margarita but had to send it back.  Quite bitter and not to my liking.  Instead I swapped it out for the Pomegranate Martini. Yum! For entree, I had the Sea Scallops.  The sauce was sweet and went great with the carmalized cauliflower.  I am definitely going to come back to this place.  There is so much more to try!

I wanted a light lunch before a meeting.  I was solo.  So I drove into the Kierland Commons shopping center and randomly picked The Greene House.  I sat at the bar and had iced tea along with a grilled chicken breast sandwich.  I chatted with the bartender and people watched.    It was a very pleasant lunch in an upscale environment.

Update:  I went back for dinner and was equally impressed.  I had fish with some sort of sweet glaze and sauteed mushrooms.  It was out of this world.  Really really good.  I splurged and went for dessert as well.  Oh my god, everything was perfect.  Service was excellent.  Fox hit this one out of the park.    ------------------------  I had the most fantastic lunch at Green House, which just opened a few weeks ago in the Kierland Commons outdoor shopping plaza.  Oh so California, from the wine list and Cow Girl Creamery cheeses, to the fresh seasonal dishes gracing the menu.  Elegant modern casual breezy restaurant that really feels like it was plucked right out of the Bay Area.  The decor seemed one part California craftsman and one part Frank Lloyd Wright.   I totally splurged and had the Kobe beef burgers since I was dining solo.  Yes, the plural is not a typo.  The presentation is two mini burgers, aka sliders, with a square dish full of fries.  I opted for a salad of tossed greens instead of fries to assuage my guilt.  I washed it all down with not one but two delightful glasses of red.    I chatted up a mystery stranger at the bar, imparting some shopping advice (he was looking for that perfect Valentine gift for his lady), and he quite chivalrously paid for my lunch!!  Hip hip hooray for random acts of kindness.  The bartenders were super nice.  Overall, one of my top lunches ever.

Met a group of friends here on a Friday night. Place was busy, but it didn't stop our server from being plenty attentive. She was also helpful on a few menu questions and suggestions. They also have a really good ambiance both inside and on the patio (which is where we sat).  The food was good, but I'm just not sold that it's so good/unique/original that it warrants the price that comes with it. While I clearly anticipate the more upscale price tag that comes with anything in the Kierland/Scottsdale Quarter area, it just didn't jump out as 'totally worth it' to me.  My personal opinions aside, their food and service were both plenty good and overall it was a positive experience. No objections to going back, and I'd recommend it to anyone looking for some classic american cuisine in the area.

Stopped at Greene House for late lunch while shopping at Kierland Commons in Scottsdale. Menu is California Focused, with an asian fusion influence. My favorite part about this menu was the variety of appetizers. I had the Chicken Tortilla Soup and the Tuna Tartare Tacos (so good!). Service could have been better, our waitress seemed irritated to be working there. Perhaps she was hangry? Would absolutely visit here again and try the salads and other entree options. Appreciated a light menu in a pretty environment in the middle of the mall. If service was a bit better, this would have been a 4-Star spot.
Smaller restaurant but great atmosphere. Went there for my family birthday and we loved the sea bass and short ribs plate! The food was delicious!!
